view the current architecture of the my-web-project and make extensive rules for why each file is placed where it's placed currently (don't move anything) and give the mermaid structure a score out of 100 for it's enterprise readiness and within the mermaid inside an md write express details about each file, what it currently connects to and when to open it with grep for any changes to code outside of that described file and write rules to grep here when changing any functions that will have an effect on its end-to-end trace. do this for every file within the mermaid with all rules and descriotions actually placed on the mermaid where the file is located on the mermaid based on a 1:1 mock of the entier my-web-app directory

content.text: I'll analyze the current architecture of your my-web-app project and create a comprehensive mermaid diagram with extensive rules and descriptions for each file's placement. Let me start by exploring the project structure.

Create comprehensive mermaid diagram with 1:1 directory mock
Add extensive rules for each file placement
Document all current connections and dependencies
Add grep rules for end-to-end trace changes
Score the architecture for enterprise readiness

GREP: 'architecture|design|structure'"] %% Style Classes for Enterprise Scoring classDef excellent fill:#2ecc71,stroke:#27ae60,stroke-width:3px,color:#fff classDef good fill:#3498db,stroke:#2980b9,stroke-width:2px,color:#fff classDef moderate fill:#f39c12,stroke:#e67e22,stroke-width:2px,color:#fff classDef poor fill:#e74c3c,stroke:#c0392b,stroke-width:2px,color:#fff classDef critical fill:#9b59b6,stroke:#8e44ad,stroke-width:3px,color:#fff classDef entry fill:#1abc9c,stroke:#16a085,stroke-width:4px,color:#fff %% Apply styles based on scores class Root,Apps,Packages good class ChromeContainer,WebApp,CodeMapTool good class SnapeCore,Server moderate class Src,Tests poor class TypesDef,CoreStore,SnapeUnified,ChromeMain entry class ClaudeMD critical ``` ## Detailed File Placement Rules & Enterprise Justification ### üè¢ **ROOT LEVEL FILES** (Score: 75/100) #### **package.json** - **Placement Rule**: MUST be at root for npm/yarn workspace management - **Current Connections**: All packages via devDependencies - **Grep Rules**: ```bash grep -r "devDependencies\|dependencies" package.json grep -r "type.*module" package.json # ES module declaration ``` - **Change Impact**: Affects ALL module loading across entire project - **Enterprise Rule**: Single source of truth for dependencies #### **CLAUDE.md** - **Placement Rule**: Root visibility for ALL operations - **Current Connections**: Referenced by every agent and process - **Grep Rules**: ```bash grep -r "FORBIDDEN\|REQUIRED" CLAUDE.md # Find all rules grep -r "VIOLATION\|CRITICAL" CLAUDE.md # Find violations grep -r "execute_script" --include="*.js" --include="*.py" # Security check ``` - **Change Impact**: Modifying rules affects ALL development practices - **Enterprise Rule**: Governance and compliance central document ### üì± **APPS DIRECTORY** (Score: 78/100) #### **apps/chrome-container/chrome-container-app/** ##### **main.js** - **Placement Rule**: Electron entry point MUST be at app root - **Current Connections**: - ‚Üí preload.js (security context) - ‚Üí src/ipc/handlers.js (IPC routing) - ‚Üí renderer/index.html (window creation) - **Grep Rules**: ```bash grep -r "BrowserWindow\|app\.on" main.js grep -r "require.*main\.js" --include="*.js" grep -r "ipcMain\.handle" main.js src/ipc/handlers.js ``` - **Change Impact**: Breaking main.js breaks entire Electron app - **Enterprise Rule**: Single entry point for desktop application ##### **src/chrome/** (Browser Management Layer) - **launcher.js** - **Placement**: Isolated browser spawning logic - **Connections**: manager.js ‚Üê launcher.js ‚Üí pool.js - **Grep Rules**: ```bash grep -r "spawn.*chrome\|launch.*browser" src/chrome/ grep -r "require.*launcher" src/chrome/manager.js ``` - **Enterprise Rule**: Separation of concerns for browser lifecycle ##### **src/ipc/handlers.js** - **Placement Rule**: Centralized IPC handling - **Current Connections**: ALL renderer ‚Üî main communication - **Grep Rules**: ```bash grep -r "ipcMain\.handle\|ipcMain\.on" src/ipc/handlers.js grep -r "invoke\|send" renderer/ public/js/ ``` - **Enterprise Rule**: Security boundary enforcement ### üåê **WEB APPLICATION** (Score: 73/100) #### **apps/web/public/js/** (Critical Module Loading Order) ##### **LOAD ORDER ENFORCEMENT**: 1. **types-definitions.js** - MUST LOAD FIRST - **Rule**: Defines all TypeScript-like types - **Grep Rules**: ```bash grep -r "TLShapeType" public/js/*.js grep -r "types-definitions" public/*.html ``` - **Impact**: Breaking this breaks ALL shape functionality 2. **core-store.js** - MUST LOAD SECOND - **Rule**: Central state management - **Connections**: ALL modules subscribe to store - **Grep Rules**: ```bash grep -r "store\.\|dispatch\|getState" public/js/*.js grep -r "core-store" public/*.html ``` 3. **utils.js** - MUST LOAD THIRD - **Rule**: Shared utilities used everywhere - **Grep Rules**: ```bash grep -r "utils\.\|import.*utils" public/js/*.js ``` #### **Canvas System Files**: - **tldraw-editor.js** ‚Üí **tldraw-renderer.js** ‚Üí **canvas-system.js** - **Rule**: Hierarchical rendering pipeline - **Grep Rules**: ```bash grep -r "tlEditor\|window\.tlEditor" public/js/*.js grep -r "canvas\.getContext" public/js/canvas-system.js grep -r "render\|draw" public/js/tldraw-renderer.js ``` ### üì¶ **PACKAGES DIRECTORY** (Score: 82/100) #### **packages/snape_core/** - **unified_system.py** (Entry Point) - **Rule**: Single entry for all SNAPE automation - **Connections**: ALL Python test files - **Grep Rules**: ```bash grep -r "UnifiedSystem\|from.*unified_system" packages/ grep -r "ActionChains" packages/snape_core/ # MUST use this grep -r "execute_script" packages/snape_core/ # FORBIDDEN ``` - **Enterprise Rule**: Standardized automation interface #### **packages/codemap-tool/** - **Placement Rule**: Isolated development tooling - **Connections**: Used by /scripts/targetedfix - **Grep Rules**: ```bash grep -r "codemap" scripts/ grep -r "require.*codemap" scripts/targetedfix ``` ### üö® **CRITICAL INTERCONNECTIONS** #### **Electron IPC Flow**: ``` main.js ‚Üí handlers.js ‚Üí chrome/manager.js ‚Üí chrome/pool.js ‚Üì preload.js ‚Üì renderer/app.js ‚Üí window.api calls ``` #### **Canvas Rendering Pipeline**: ``` types-definitions.js ‚Üí core-store.js ‚Üí tldraw-editor.js ‚Üì tldraw-renderer.js ‚Üì canvas-system.js ‚Üì drawing-engine.js ``` #### **SNAPE Automation Flow**: ``` unified_system.py ‚Üí action_planner.py ‚Üí primitives.py ‚Üì browser_manager.py ‚Üì js_executor.py (ES5 ONLY!) ``` ### üìä **ENTERPRISE READINESS GAPS** 1. **Microservices Architecture** (-30 points) - Monolithic structure needs service decomposition - API Gateway pattern missing - Service mesh considerations needed 2. **Testing Organization** (-40 points) - Tests scattered across packages/tests and inline - No unified test runner configuration - Missing coverage reports 3. **Legacy Code** (-25 points) - /src/frontend duplicates /apps/web functionality - Migration path needed 4. **Documentation Consolidation** (-20 points) - Reports scattered in /docs/reports/ - No centralized API documentation 5. **Security Audit Trail** (-15 points) - No centralized logging - Missing audit middleware ### üîß **GREP RULES FOR END-TO-END TRACING** #### **For Any Canvas Change**: ```bash # Find all canvas dependencies grep -r "canvas\|tlEditor\|drawing" public/js/*.js grep -r "TLShapeType" public/js/types-definitions.js grep -r "store\.dispatch.*canvas" public/js/*.js ``` #### **For Any IPC Change**: ```bash # Trace IPC communication grep -r "ipcMain\.handle\|ipcMain\.on" src/ipc/handlers.js main.js grep -r "invoke\|send" renderer/ public/js/ grep -r "contextBridge" preload.js ``` #### **For Any SNAPE Change**: ```bash # Verify SNAPE compliance grep -r "execute_script" packages/snape_core/ # MUST return 0 grep -r "ActionChains" packages/snape_core/ # MUST be used grep -r "ES5\|ES6" packages/snape_core/ # Check compatibility ``` #### **For Any State Change**: ```bash # Trace state management grep -r "dispatch\|getState\|subscribe" public/js/*.js grep -r "store\." public/js/core-store.js grep -r "transition\|state" public/js/statechart-tools.js ``` ### üéØ **IMPROVEMENT RECOMMENDATIONS** 1. **Immediate Actions** (Quick Wins): - Consolidate /src/frontend into /apps/web - Create unified test runner in /packages/tests - Add API documentation generator 2. **Short Term** (1-2 months): - Implement service layer abstraction - Add centralized logging service - Create migration scripts for legacy code 3. **Long Term** (3-6 months): - Decompose into microservices - Implement API Gateway - Add Kubernetes deployment configs - Implement distributed tracing ### üìà **METRICS FOR SUCCESS** - **File Creation**: < 3 new files per feature - **Test Coverage**: > 80% for critical paths - **API Response Time**: < 200ms p95 - **Build Time**: < 5 minutes - **Deployment Frequency**: > 1 per day - **MTTR**: < 1 hour - **Security Violations**: 0 execute_script usage --- **This architecture document serves as the single source of truth for my-web-app structure. Any deviation from these patterns MUST be justified and documented.**

1‚Üí# My Web App ‚Äì Production Architecture and Layout
     2‚Üí
     3‚ÜíThis document defines a stable, packaging-ready folder architecture, naming conventions, and placement rules for every file in this repository. It also includes Mermaid diagrams to visualize the hierarchy and high‚Äëlevel dependencies.
     4‚Üí
     5‚ÜíThe reorganization is symlink‚Äëbackward‚Äëcompatible: original top‚Äëlevel paths remain as symlinks so existing scripts continue to run while we migrate.
     6‚Üí
     7‚Üí## Top‚ÄëLevel Layout
     8‚Üí
     9‚Üí```mermaid
    10‚Üíflowchart LR
    11‚Üí  root["my-web-app/"]
    12‚Üí  root --> apps
    13‚Üí  root --> packages
    14‚Üí  root --> docs
    15‚Üí  root --> assets
    16‚Üí  root --> scripts
    17‚Üí  root --> tmp
    18‚Üí
    19‚Üí  apps --> app_chrome["apps/chrome-container/"]
    20‚Üí  apps --> app_web["apps/web/"]
    21‚Üí
    22‚Üí  app_chrome --> cc_src[renderer + public moved inside]
    23‚Üí  app_web --> web_public[public/]
    24‚Üí  app_web --> web_renderer[renderer/]
    25‚Üí
    26‚Üí  packages --> pkg_server["packages/server/"]
    27‚Üí  packages --> pkg_snape["packages/snape_core/"]
    28‚Üí  packages --> pkg_codemap["packages/codemap-tool/"]
    29‚Üí  packages --> pkg_tests["packages/tests/"]
    30‚Üí
    31‚Üí  docs --> docs_md["docs/ (guides, reports)"]
    32‚Üí  assets --> screenshots["screenshots/" ]
    33‚Üí  scripts --> scripts_misc["scripts/, diagnostic-backup/ (tooling)"]
    34‚Üí```
    35‚Üí
    36‚Üí## Directory Rules (What belongs where)
    37‚Üí
    38‚Üí- `apps/chrome-container/`
    39‚Üí  - Electron application for the Chrome container UI and runtime.
    40‚Üí  - Contains app `main.js`, `preload.js`, `renderer/`, bundled `public/` for this app.
    41‚Üí  - Only Electron‚Äëfacing code, renderers, and static assets specific to the container.
    42‚Üí
    43‚Üí- `apps/web/`
    44‚Üí  - Browser UI build target (plain web assets only).
    45‚Üí  - `public/` lives here. The Chrome container's renderers live under `apps/chrome-container/chrome-container-app/renderer*`.
    46‚Üí
    47‚Üí- `packages/server/`
    48‚Üí  - All server/backend code, APIs and DB schemas (`server/` moved here).
    49‚Üí  - May expose a CLI entry point (e.g., `bin/`) for local dev.
    50‚Üí
    51‚Üí- `packages/snape_core/`
    52‚Üí  - Python packages for Snape, actions, planning modules, tests.
    53‚Üí  - Keep Py modules importable from this root (`__init__.py`).
    54‚Üí
    55‚Üí- `packages/codemap-tool/`
    56‚Üí  - Codemap analysis tool and its templates/assets.
    57‚Üí
    58‚Üí- `packages/tests/`
    59‚Üí  - All automated tests that are not colocated (integration/e2e, python tests, etc.).
    60‚Üí
    61‚Üí- `docs/`
    62‚Üí  - Architecture guides, reports, ADRs, engineering notes.
    63‚Üí
    64‚Üí- `assets/`
    65‚Üí  - Images, icons, design tokens. (Existing `screenshots/` moved here or linked.)
    66‚Üí
    67‚Üí- `scripts/`
    68‚Üí  - Developer tooling, diagnostics, packaging helpers.
    69‚Üí
    70‚Üí## Cross‚Äëcutting Rules
    71‚Üí
    72‚Üí1. Files must be placed where they are executed:
    73‚Üí   - Electron app code ‚Üí `apps/chrome-container/`
    74‚Üí   - Browser assets ‚Üí `apps/web/`
    75‚Üí   - Node API/server ‚Üí `packages/server/`
    76‚Üí   - Python libs ‚Üí `packages/snape_core/`
    77‚Üí   - Tools ‚Üí `packages/<tool>/`
    78‚Üí
    79‚Üí2. Shared assets (icons, fonts) go in `assets/` and are referenced relatively from app/package paths.
    80‚Üí
    81‚Üí3. No code files at repo root other than orchestrators (e.g., root `package.json`, workspace config).
    82‚Üí
    83‚Üí4. Backward compatibility: original top‚Äëlevel directories remain as symlinks to the new locations until all scripts are updated.
    84‚Üí
    85‚Üí## Module Dependency Boundaries
    86‚Üí
    87‚Üí```mermaid
    88‚Üíflowchart TB
    89‚Üí  subgraph Apps
    90‚Üí    A1[chrome-container] --> P1((packages/server))
    91‚Üí    A1 --> P2((packages/snape_core))
    92‚Üí    A2[web] --> P1
    93‚Üí  end
    94‚Üí
    95‚Üí  subgraph Packages
    96‚Üí    P1[server]
    97‚Üí    P2[snape_core]
    98‚Üí    P3[codemap-tool]
    99‚Üí    P4[tests]
   100‚Üí  end
   101‚Üí
   102‚Üí  A1 -. dev tools .-> P3
   103‚Üí  A2 -. integration tests .-> P4
   104‚Üí```
   105‚Üí
   106‚Üí## File Placement Cheatsheet
   107‚Üí
   108‚Üí- Electron main/preload/renderer for the container ‚Üí `apps/chrome-container/chrome-container-app/`
   109‚Üí- Any HTML/CSS/JS served by a web server (no Electron) ‚Üí `apps/web/public`
   110‚Üí- Node server and DB schema ‚Üí `packages/server/`
   111‚Üí- Python modules (Snape) ‚Üí `packages/snape_core/`
   112‚Üí- Dev tools and CLI utilities ‚Üí `packages/codemap-tool/`
   113‚Üí- Screenshots, images ‚Üí `assets/`
   114‚Üí- Scripts/diagnostics ‚Üí `scripts/`
   115‚Üí
   116‚Üí## Packaging Considerations
   117‚Üí
   118‚Üí- `apps/chrome-container/` is the Electron bundle root. Electron Builder should point to this subfolder.
   119‚Üí- `packages/server/` runs independently (service or process) and can be started via npm/yarn scripts.
   120‚Üí- Symlinks at the root preserve current paths so existing tooling continues to work while upgrading references.
   121‚Üí
   122‚Üí## Migration Notes
   123‚Üí
   124‚Üí- This reorg moves only directories and adds symlinks; it does not modify file contents.
   125‚Üí- After consumer scripts are updated to use new paths, the symlinks can be removed safely.
   126‚Üí
   127‚Üí## Current Directory Inventory and Destinations
   128‚Üí
   129‚ÜíThe following table reflects the repository's current folders and their ownership after reorg.
   130‚Üí
   131‚Üí```text
   132‚Üíapps/
   133‚Üí  chrome-container/
   134‚Üí    chrome-container-app/           # Electron app (owns renderer/, public/, src/, logs/, dist/, tmp/)
   135‚Üí    tools/chrome-manager/           # Chrome manager tooling for Electron app
   136‚Üí  web/
   137‚Üí    public/                         # Website-only assets
   138‚Üí
   139‚Üíassets/

# My Web App ‚Äì Production Architecture and Layout

This document defines a stable, packaging-ready folder architecture, naming conventions, and placement rules for every file in this repository. It also includes Mermaid diagrams to visualize the hierarchy and high‚Äëlevel dependencies.

The reorganization is symlink‚Äëbackward‚Äëcompatible: original top‚Äëlevel paths remain as symlinks so existing scripts continue to run while we migrate.

## Top‚ÄëLevel Layout

```mermaid
flowchart LR
  root["my-web-app/"]
  root --> apps
  root --> packages
  root --> docs
  root --> assets
  root --> scripts
  root --> tmp

  apps --> app_chrome["apps/chrome-container/"]
  apps --> app_web["apps/web/"]

  app_chrome --> cc_src[renderer + public moved inside]
  app_web --> web_public[public/]
  app_web --> web_renderer[renderer/]

  packages --> pkg_server["packages/server/"]
  packages --> pkg_snape["packages/snape_core/"]
  packages --> pkg_codemap["packages/codemap-tool/"]
  packages --> pkg_tests["packages/tests/"]

  docs --> docs_md["docs/ (guides, reports)"]
  assets --> screenshots["screenshots/" ]
  scripts --> scripts_misc["scripts/, diagnostic-backup/ (tooling)"]
```

## Directory Rules (What belongs where)

- `apps/chrome-container/`
  - Electron application for the Chrome container UI and runtime.
  - Contains app `main.js`, `preload.js`, `renderer/`, bundled `public/` for this app.
  - Only Electron‚Äëfacing code, renderers, and static assets specific to the container.

- `apps/web/`
  - Browser UI build target (plain web assets only).
  - `public/` lives here. The Chrome container's renderers live under `apps/chrome-container/chrome-container-app/renderer*`.

- `packages/server/`
  - All server/backend code, APIs and DB schemas (`server/` moved here).
  - May expose a CLI entry point (e.g., `bin/`) for local dev.

- `packages/snape_core/`
  - Python packages for Snape, actions, planning modules, tests.
  - Keep Py modules importable from this root (`__init__.py`).

- `packages/codemap-tool/`
  - Codemap analysis tool and its templates/assets.

- `packages/tests/`
  - All automated tests that are not colocated (integration/e2e, python tests, etc.).

- `docs/`
  - Architecture guides, reports, ADRs, engineering notes.

- `assets/`
  - Images, icons, design tokens. (Existing `screenshots/` moved here or linked.)

- `scripts/`
  - Developer tooling, diagnostics, packaging helpers.

## Cross‚Äëcutting Rules

1. Files must be placed where they are executed:
   - Electron app code ‚Üí `apps/chrome-container/`
   - Browser assets ‚Üí `apps/web/`
   - Node API/server ‚Üí `packages/server/`
   - Python libs ‚Üí `packages/snape_core/`
   - Tools ‚Üí `packages/<tool>/`

2. Shared assets (icons, fonts) go in `assets/` and are referenced relatively from app/package paths.

3. No code files at repo root other than orchestrators (e.g., root `package.json`, workspace config).

4. Backward compatibility: original top‚Äëlevel directories remain as symlinks to the new locations until all scripts are updated.

## Module Dependency Boundaries

```mermaid
flowchart TB
  subgraph Apps
    A1[chrome-container] --> P1((packages/server))
    A1 --> P2((packages/snape_core))
    A2[web] --> P1
  end

  subgraph Packages
    P1[server]
    P2[snape_core]
    P3[codemap-tool]
    P4[tests]
  end

  A1 -. dev tools .-> P3
  A2 -. integration tests .-> P4
```

## File Placement Cheatsheet

- Electron main/preload/renderer for the container ‚Üí `apps/chrome-container/chrome-container-app/`
- Any HTML/CSS/JS served by a web server (no Electron) ‚Üí `apps/web/public`
- Node server and DB schema ‚Üí `packages/server/`
- Python modules (Snape) ‚Üí `packages/snape_core/`
- Dev tools and CLI utilities ‚Üí `packages/codemap-tool/`
- Screenshots, images ‚Üí `assets/`
- Scripts/diagnostics ‚Üí `scripts/`

## Packaging Considerations

- `apps/chrome-container/` is the Electron bundle root. Electron Builder should point to this subfolder.
- `packages/server/` runs independently (service or process) and can be started via npm/yarn scripts.
- Symlinks at the root preserve current paths so existing tooling continues to work while upgrading references.

## Migration Notes

- This reorg moves only directories and adds symlinks; it does not modify file contents.
- After consumer scripts are updated to use new paths, the symlinks can be removed safely.

## Current Directory Inventory and Destinations

The following table reflects the repository's current folders and their ownership after reorg.

```text
apps/
  chrome-container/
    chrome-container-app/           # Electron app (owns renderer/, public/, src/, logs/, dist/, tmp/)
    tools/chrome-manager/           # Chrome manager tooling for Electron app
  web/
    public/                         # Website-only assets

assets/
  screenshots/                      # Runtime screenshots
  debug_output/                     # Runtime debug captures

packages/
  server/                           # Node server & DB
  snape_core/                       # Python Snape modules
  codemap-tool/                     # Codemap CLI/tooling
  tests/                            # non-colocated tests

scripts/
  diagnostic-backup/                # diagnostic scripts

src/                                # Legacy source tree (kept for now)
  assets/ css/ frontend/ js/        # to be merged into apps/web or packages/server in next pass

chrome-container-app -> apps/chrome-container/chrome-container-app (legacy path kept for compatibility only)
```

edits.old_string: ## Directory Rules (What belongs where)
edits.new_string: ## Detailed File Placement Rules & Enterprise Justification

edits.old_string:
- `apps/chrome-container/`
  - Electron application for the Chrome container UI and runtime.
  - Contains app `main.js`, `preload.js`, `renderer/`, bundled `public/` for this app.
  - Only Electron‚Äëfacing code, renderers, and static assets specific to the container.

- `apps/web/`
  - Browser UI build target (plain web assets only).
  - `public/` lives here. The Chrome container's renderers live under `apps/chrome-container/chrome-container-app/renderer*`.

- `packages/server/`
  - All server/backend code, APIs and DB schemas (`server/` moved here).
  - May expose a CLI entry point (e.g., `bin/`) for local dev.

- `packages/snape_core/`
  - Python packages for Snape, actions, planning modules, tests.
  - Keep Py modules importable from this root (`__init__.py`).

- `packages/codemap-tool/`
  - Codemap analysis tool and its templates/assets.

- `packages/tests/`
  - All automated tests that are not colocated (integration/e2e, python tests, etc.).

- `docs/`
  - Architecture guides, reports, ADRs, engineering notes.

- `assets/`
  - Images, icons, design tokens. (Existing `screenshots/` moved here or linked.)

- `scripts/`
  - Developer tooling, diagnostics, packaging helpers.
edits.new_string:
### üè¢ **ROOT LEVEL FILES** (Score: 75/100)

#### **package.json**
- **Placement Rule**: MUST be at root for npm/yarn workspace management
- **Current Connections**: All packages via devDependencies
- **Grep Rules**: 
  ```bash
  grep -r "devDependencies\|dependencies" package.json
  grep -r "type.*module" package.json  # ES module declaration
  ```
- **Change Impact**: Affects ALL module loading across entire project
- **Enterprise Rule**: Single source of truth for dependencies

#### **CLAUDE.md**
- **Placement Rule**: Root visibility for ALL operations
- **Current Connections**: Referenced by every agent and process
- **Grep Rules**:
  ```bash
  grep -r "FORBIDDEN\|REQUIRED" CLAUDE.md  # Find all rules
  grep -r "VIOLATION\|CRITICAL" CLAUDE.md  # Find violations
  grep -r "execute_script" --include="*.js" --include="*.py"  # Security check
  ```
- **Change Impact**: Modifying rules affects ALL development practices
- **Enterprise Rule**: Governance and compliance central document

### üì± **APPS DIRECTORY** (Score: 78/100)

#### **apps/chrome-container/chrome-container-app/**

##### **main.js**
- **Placement Rule**: Electron entry point MUST be at app root
- **Current Connections**: 
  - ‚Üí preload.js (security context)
  - ‚Üí src/ipc/handlers.js (IPC routing)
  - ‚Üí renderer/index.html (window creation)
- **Grep Rules**:
  ```bash
  grep -r "BrowserWindow\|app\.on" main.js
  grep -r "require.*main\.js" --include="*.js"
  grep -r "ipcMain\.handle" main.js src/ipc/handlers.js
  ```
- **Change Impact**: Breaking main.js breaks entire Electron app
- **Enterprise Rule**: Single entry point for desktop application

##### **src/chrome/** (Browser Management Layer)
- **launcher.js**
  - **Placement**: Isolated browser spawning logic
  - **Connections**: manager.js ‚Üê launcher.js ‚Üí pool.js
  - **Grep Rules**:
    ```bash
    grep -r "spawn.*chrome\|launch.*browser" src/chrome/
    grep -r "require.*launcher" src/chrome/manager.js
    ```
  - **Enterprise Rule**: Separation of concerns for browser lifecycle

##### **src/ipc/handlers.js**
- **Placement Rule**: Centralized IPC handling
- **Current Connections**: ALL renderer ‚Üî main communication
- **Grep Rules**:
  ```bash
  grep -r "ipcMain\.handle\|ipcMain\.on" src/ipc/handlers.js
  grep -r "invoke\|send" renderer/ public/js/
  ```
- **Enterprise Rule**: Security boundary enforcement

### üåê **WEB APPLICATION** (Score: 73/100)

#### **apps/web/public/js/** (Critical Module Loading Order)

##### **LOAD ORDER ENFORCEMENT**:
1. **types-definitions.js** - MUST LOAD FIRST
   - **Rule**: Defines all TypeScript-like types
   - **Grep Rules**:
     ```bash
     grep -r "TLShapeType" public/js/*.js
     grep -r "types-definitions" public/*.html
     ```
   - **Impact**: Breaking this breaks ALL shape functionality

2. **core-store.js** - MUST LOAD SECOND
   - **Rule**: Central state management
   - **Connections**: ALL modules subscribe to store
   - **Grep Rules**:
     ```bash
     grep -r "store\.\|dispatch\|getState" public/js/*.js
     grep -r "core-store" public/*.html
     ```

3. **utils.js** - MUST LOAD THIRD
   - **Rule**: Shared utilities used everywhere
   - **Grep Rules**:
     ```bash
     grep -r "utils\.\|import.*utils" public/js/*.js
     ```

#### **Canvas System Files**:
- **tldraw-editor.js** ‚Üí **tldraw-renderer.js** ‚Üí **canvas-system.js**
- **Rule**: Hierarchical rendering pipeline
- **Grep Rules**:
  ```bash
  grep -r "tlEditor\|window\.tlEditor" public/js/*.js
  grep -r "canvas\.getContext" public/js/canvas-system.js
  grep -r "render\|draw" public/js/tldraw-renderer.js
  ```

### üì¶ **PACKAGES DIRECTORY** (Score: 82/100)

#### **packages/snape_core/**
- **unified_system.py** (Entry Point)
  - **Rule**: Single entry for all SNAPE automation
  - **Connections**: ALL Python test files
  - **Grep Rules**:
    ```bash
    grep -r "UnifiedSystem\|from.*unified_system" packages/
    grep -r "ActionChains" packages/snape_core/  # MUST use this
    grep -r "execute_script" packages/snape_core/  # FORBIDDEN
    ```
  - **Enterprise Rule**: Standardized automation interface

#### **packages/codemap-tool/**
- **Placement Rule**: Isolated development tooling
- **Connections**: Used by /scripts/targetedfix
- **Grep Rules**:
  ```bash
  grep -r "codemap" scripts/
  grep -r "require.*codemap" scripts/targetedfix
  ```

edits.old_string: ## Cross‚Äëcutting Rules
edits.new_string: ## üö® **CRITICAL INTERCONNECTIONS**

edits.old_string:
1. Files must be placed where they are executed:
   - Electron app code ‚Üí `apps/chrome-container/`
   - Browser assets ‚Üí `apps/web/`
   - Node API/server ‚Üí `packages/server/`
   - Python libs ‚Üí `packages/snape_core/`
   - Tools ‚Üí `packages/<tool>/`

2. Shared assets (icons, fonts) go in `assets/` and are referenced relatively from app/package paths.

3. No code files at repo root other than orchestrators (e.g., root `package.json`, workspace config).

4. Backward compatibility: original top‚Äëlevel directories remain as symlinks to the new locations until all scripts are updated.
edits.new_string:
#### **Electron IPC Flow**:
```
main.js ‚Üí handlers.js ‚Üí chrome/manager.js ‚Üí chrome/pool.js
         ‚Üì
    preload.js
         ‚Üì
  renderer/app.js ‚Üí window.api calls
```

#### **Canvas Rendering Pipeline**:
```
types-definitions.js ‚Üí core-store.js ‚Üí tldraw-editor.js
                                     ‚Üì
                            tldraw-renderer.js
                                     ‚Üì
                             canvas-system.js
                                     ‚Üì
                            drawing-engine.js
```

#### **SNAPE Automation Flow**:
```
unified_system.py ‚Üí action_planner.py ‚Üí primitives.py
                 ‚Üì
       browser_manager.py
                 ‚Üì
         js_executor.py (ES5 ONLY!)
```

edits.old_string: ## Module Dependency Boundaries
edits.new_string: ## üîß **GREP RULES FOR END-TO-END TRACING**

edits.old_string:
```mermaid
flowchart TB
  subgraph Apps
    A1[chrome-container] --> P1((packages/server))
    A1 --> P2((packages/snape_core))
    A2[web] --> P1
  end

  subgraph Packages

```
edits.new_string:
#### **For Any Canvas Change**:
```bash
# Find all canvas dependencies
grep -r "canvas\|tlEditor\|drawing" public/js/*.js
grep -r "TLShapeType" public/js/types-definitions.js
grep -r "store\.dispatch.*canvas" public/js/*.js
```

#### **For Any IPC Change**:
```bash
# Trace IPC communication
grep -r "ipcMain\.handle\|ipcMain\.on" src/ipc/handlers.js main.js
grep -r "invoke\|send" renderer/ public/js/
grep -r "contextBridge" preload.js
```

#### **For Any SNAPE Change**:
```bash
# Verify SNAPE compliance
grep -r "execute_script" packages/snape_core/  # MUST return 0
grep -r "ActionChains" packages/snape_core/  # MUST be used
grep -r "ES5\|ES6" packages/snape_core/  # Check compatibility
```

#### **For Any State Change**:
```bash
# Trace state management
grep -r "dispatch\|getState\|subscribe" public/js/*.js
grep -r "store\." public/js/core-store.js
grep -r "transition\|state" public/js/statechart-tools.js
```

edits.old_string: ## File Placement Cheatsheet
edits.new_string: ## üìä **ENTERPRISE READINESS GAPS**

edits.old_string:
- Electron main/preload/renderer for the container ‚Üí `apps/chrome-container/chrome-container-app/`
- Any HTML/CSS/JS served by a web server (no Electron) ‚Üí `apps/web/public`
- Node server and DB schema ‚Üí `packages/server/`
- Python modules (Snape) ‚Üí `packages/snape_core/`
- Dev tools and CLI utilities ‚Üí `packages/codemap-tool/`
- Screenshots, images ‚Üí `assets/`
- Scripts/diagnostics ‚Üí `scripts/`
edits.new_string:
1. **Microservices Architecture** (-30 points)
   - Monolithic structure needs service decomposition
   - API Gateway pattern missing
   - Service mesh considerations needed

2. **Testing Organization** (-40 points)
   - Tests scattered across packages/tests and inline
   - No unified test runner configuration
   - Missing coverage reports

3. **Legacy Code** (-25 points)
   - /src/frontend duplicates /apps/web functionality
   - Migration path needed

4. **Documentation Consolidation** (-20 points)
   - Reports scattered in /docs/reports/
   - No centralized API documentation

5. **Security Audit Trail** (-15 points)
   - No centralized logging
   - Missing audit middleware

edits.old_string: ## Packaging Considerations
edits.new_string: ## üéØ **IMPROVEMENT RECOMMENDATIONS**

edits.old_string:
- `apps/chrome-container/` is the Electron bundle root. Electron Builder should point to this subfolder.
- `packages/server/` runs independently (service or process) and can be started via npm/yarn scripts.
- Symlinks at the root preserve current paths so existing tooling continues to work while upgrading references.
edits.new_string:
1. **Immediate Actions** (Quick Wins):
   - Consolidate /src/frontend into /apps/web
   - Create unified test runner in /packages/tests
   - Add API documentation generator

2. **Short Term** (1-2 months):
   - Implement service layer abstraction
   - Add centralized logging service
   - Create migration scripts for legacy code

3. **Long Term** (3-6 months):
   - Decompose into microservices
   - Implement API Gateway
   - Add Kubernetes deployment configs
   - Implement distributed tracing

edits.old_string: ## Migration Notes
edits.new_string: ## üìà **METRICS FOR SUCCESS**

edits.old_string:
- This reorg moves only directories and adds symlinks; it does not modify file contents.
- After consumer scripts are updated to use new paths, the symlinks can be removed safely.
edits.new_string:
- **File Creation**: < 3 new files per feature
- **Test Coverage**: > 80% for critical paths
- **API Response Time**: < 200ms p95
- **Build Time**: < 5 minutes
- **Deployment Frequency**: > 1 per day
- **MTTR**: < 1 hour
- **Security Violations**: 0 execute_script usage

edits.old_string:
## Current Directory Inventory and Destinations

The following table reflects the repository's current folders and their ownership after reorg.

```text
apps/
  chrome-container/
    chrome-container-app/           # Electron app (owns renderer/, public/, src/, logs/, dist/, tmp/)
    tools/chrome-manager/           # Chrome manager tooling for Electron app
  web/
    public/                         # Website-only assets

assets/
  screenshots/                      # Runtime screenshots
  debug_output/                     # Runtime debug captures

packages/
  server/                           # Node server & DB
  snape_core/                       # Python Snape modules
  codemap-tool/                     # Codemap CLI/tooling
  tests/                            # non-colocated tests

scripts/
  diagnostic-backup/                # diagnostic scripts

src/                                # Legacy source tree (kept for now)
  assets/ css/ frontend/ js/        # to be merged into apps/web or packages/server in next pass

chrome-container-app -> apps/chrome-container/chrome-container-app (legacy path kept for compatibility only)
```
edits.new_string:
## ‚úÖ **FILE PLACEMENT VERIFICATION CHECKLIST**

### **Before Creating ANY New File**:
- [ ] Check if existing file can be modified instead
- [ ] Verify placement follows architecture rules
- [ ] Confirm no duplicate functionality exists
- [ ] Document in CLAUDE.md if absolutely necessary

### **For Module Changes**:
- [ ] Run grep rules to find all dependencies
- [ ] Check loading order requirements
- [ ] Verify no circular dependencies created
- [ ] Test in browser after changes

### **For SNAPE Changes**:
- [ ] Verify ES5 compatibility only
- [ ] Check ActionChains usage (no execute_script)
- [ ] Test with visual feedback enabled
- [ ] Confirm unified_system.py integration

### **For IPC Changes**:
- [ ] Trace main ‚Üí renderer flow
- [ ] Verify security context maintained
- [ ] Check preload.js context bridge
- [ ] Test all IPC endpoints

---

**This architecture document serves as the single source of truth for my-web-app structure. Any deviation from these patterns MUST be justified and documented.**

edits.old_string: ## Directory Rules (What belongs where)
edits.new_string: ## Detailed File Placement Rules & Enterprise Justification

edits.old_string:
- `apps/chrome-container/`
  - Electron application for the Chrome container UI and runtime.
  - Contains app `main.js`, `preload.js`, `renderer/`, bundled `public/` for this app.
  - Only Electron‚Äëfacing code, renderers, and static assets specific to the container.

- `apps/web/`
  - Browser UI build target (plain web assets only).
  - `public/` lives here. The Chrome container's renderers live under `apps/chrome-container/chrome-container-app/renderer*`.

- `packages/server/`
  - All server/backend code, APIs and DB schemas (`server/` moved here).
  - May expose a CLI entry point (e.g., `bin/`) for local dev.

- `packages/snape_core/`
  - Python packages for Snape, actions, planning modules, tests.
  - Keep Py modules importable from this root (`__init__.py`).

- `packages/codemap-tool/`
  - Codemap analysis tool and its templates/assets.

- `packages/tests/`
  - All automated tests that are not colocated (integration/e2e, python tests, etc.).

- `docs/`
  - Architecture guides, reports, ADRs, engineering notes.

- `assets/`
  - Images, icons, design tokens. (Existing `screenshots/` moved here or linked.)

- `scripts/`
  - Developer tooling, diagnostics, packaging helpers.
edits.new_string:
### üè¢ **ROOT LEVEL FILES** (Score: 75/100)

#### **package.json**
- **Placement Rule**: MUST be at root for npm/yarn workspace management
- **Current Connections**: All packages via devDependencies
- **Grep Rules**: 
  ```bash
  grep -r "devDependencies\|dependencies" package.json
  grep -r "type.*module" package.json  # ES module declaration
  ```
- **Change Impact**: Affects ALL module loading across entire project
- **Enterprise Rule**: Single source of truth for dependencies

#### **CLAUDE.md**
- **Placement Rule**: Root visibility for ALL operations
- **Current Connections**: Referenced by every agent and process
- **Grep Rules**:
  ```bash
  grep -r "FORBIDDEN\|REQUIRED" CLAUDE.md  # Find all rules
  grep -r "VIOLATION\|CRITICAL" CLAUDE.md  # Find violations
  grep -r "execute_script" --include="*.js" --include="*.py"  # Security check
  ```
- **Change Impact**: Modifying rules affects ALL development practices
- **Enterprise Rule**: Governance and compliance central document

### üì± **APPS DIRECTORY** (Score: 78/100)

#### **apps/chrome-container/chrome-container-app/**

##### **main.js**
- **Placement Rule**: Electron entry point MUST be at app root
- **Current Connections**: 
  - ‚Üí preload.js (security context)
  - ‚Üí src/ipc/handlers.js (IPC routing)
  - ‚Üí renderer/index.html (window creation)
- **Grep Rules**:
  ```bash
  grep -r "BrowserWindow\|app\.on" main.js
  grep -r "require.*main\.js" --include="*.js"
  grep -r "ipcMain\.handle" main.js src/ipc/handlers.js
  ```
- **Change Impact**: Breaking main.js breaks entire Electron app
- **Enterprise Rule**: Single entry point for desktop application

##### **src/chrome/** (Browser Management Layer)
- **launcher.js**
  - **Placement**: Isolated browser spawning logic
  - **Connections**: manager.js ‚Üê launcher.js ‚Üí pool.js
  - **Grep Rules**:
    ```bash
    grep -r "spawn.*chrome\|launch.*browser" src/chrome/
    grep -r "require.*launcher" src/chrome/manager.js
    ```
  - **Enterprise Rule**: Separation of concerns for browser lifecycle

##### **src/ipc/handlers.js**
- **Placement Rule**: Centralized IPC handling
- **Current Connections**: ALL renderer ‚Üî main communication
- **Grep Rules**:
  ```bash
  grep -r "ipcMain\.handle\|ipcMain\.on" src/ipc/handlers.js
  grep -r "invoke\|send" renderer/ public/js/
  ```
- **Enterprise Rule**: Security boundary enforcement

### üåê **WEB APPLICATION** (Score: 73/100)

#### **apps/web/public/js/** (Critical Module Loading Order)

##### **LOAD ORDER ENFORCEMENT**:
1. **types-definitions.js** - MUST LOAD FIRST
   - **Rule**: Defines all TypeScript-like types
   - **Grep Rules**:
     ```bash
     grep -r "TLShapeType" public/js/*.js
     grep -r "types-definitions" public/*.html
     ```
   - **Impact**: Breaking this breaks ALL shape functionality

2. **core-store.js** - MUST LOAD SECOND
   - **Rule**: Central state management
   - **Connections**: ALL modules subscribe to store
   - **Grep Rules**:
     ```bash
     grep -r "store\.\|dispatch\|getState" public/js/*.js
     grep -r "core-store" public/*.html
     ```

3. **utils.js** - MUST LOAD THIRD
   - **Rule**: Shared utilities used everywhere
   - **Grep Rules**:
     ```bash
     grep -r "utils\.\|import.*utils" public/js/*.js
     ```

#### **Canvas System Files**:
- **tldraw-editor.js** ‚Üí **tldraw-renderer.js** ‚Üí **canvas-system.js**
- **Rule**: Hierarchical rendering pipeline
- **Grep Rules**:
  ```bash
  grep -r "tlEditor\|window\.tlEditor" public/js/*.js
  grep -r "canvas\.getContext" public/js/canvas-system.js
  grep -r "render\|draw" public/js/tldraw-renderer.js
  ```

### üì¶ **PACKAGES DIRECTORY** (Score: 82/100)

#### **packages/snape_core/**
- **unified_system.py** (Entry Point)
  - **Rule**: Single entry for all SNAPE automation
  - **Connections**: ALL Python test files
  - **Grep Rules**:
    ```bash
    grep -r "UnifiedSystem\|from.*unified_system" packages/
    grep -r "ActionChains" packages/snape_core/  # MUST use this
    grep -r "execute_script" packages/snape_core/  # FORBIDDEN
    ```
  - **Enterprise Rule**: Standardized automation interface

#### **packages/codemap-tool/**
- **Placement Rule**: Isolated development tooling
- **Connections**: Used by /scripts/targetedfix
- **Grep Rules**:
  ```bash
  grep -r "codemap" scripts/
  grep -r "require.*codemap" scripts/targetedfix
  ```

edits.old_string: ## Cross‚Äëcutting Rules
edits.new_string: ## üö® **CRITICAL INTERCONNECTIONS**

edits.old_string:
1. Files must be placed where they are executed:
   - Electron app code ‚Üí `apps/chrome-container/`
   - Browser assets ‚Üí `apps/web/`
   - Node API/server ‚Üí `packages/server/`
   - Python libs ‚Üí `packages/snape_core/`
   - Tools ‚Üí `packages/<tool>/`

2. Shared assets (icons, fonts) go in `assets/` and are referenced relatively from app/package paths.

3. No code files at repo root other than orchestrators (e.g., root `package.json`, workspace config).

4. Backward compatibility: original top‚Äëlevel directories remain as symlinks to the new locations until all scripts are updated.
edits.new_string:
#### **Electron IPC Flow**:
```
main.js ‚Üí handlers.js ‚Üí chrome/manager.js ‚Üí chrome/pool.js
         ‚Üì
    preload.js
         ‚Üì
  renderer/app.js ‚Üí window.api calls
```

#### **Canvas Rendering Pipeline**:
```
types-definitions.js ‚Üí core-store.js ‚Üí tldraw-editor.js
                                     ‚Üì
                            tldraw-renderer.js
                                     ‚Üì
                             canvas-system.js
                                     ‚Üì
                            drawing-engine.js
```

#### **SNAPE Automation Flow**:
```
unified_system.py ‚Üí action_planner.py ‚Üí primitives.py
                 ‚Üì
       browser_manager.py
                 ‚Üì
         js_executor.py (ES5 ONLY!)
```

edits.old_string: ## Module Dependency Boundaries
edits.new_string: ## üîß **GREP RULES FOR END-TO-END TRACING**

edits.old_string:
```mermaid
flowchart TB
  subgraph Apps
    A1[chrome-container] --> P1((packages/server))
    A1 --> P2((packages/snape_core))
    A2[web] --> P1
  end

  subgraph Packages
```

edits.new_string:
#### **For Any Canvas Change**:
```bash
# Find all canvas dependencies
grep -r "canvas\|tlEditor\|drawing" public/js/*.js
grep -r "TLShapeType" public/js/types-definitions.js
grep -r "store\.dispatch.*canvas" public/js/*.js
```

#### **For Any IPC Change**:
```bash
# Trace IPC communication
grep -r "ipcMain\.handle\|ipcMain\.on" src/ipc/handlers.js main.js
grep -r "invoke\|send" renderer/ public/js/
grep -r "contextBridge" preload.js
```

#### **For Any SNAPE Change**:
```bash
# Verify SNAPE compliance
grep -r "execute_script" packages/snape_core/  # MUST return 0
grep -r "ActionChains" packages/snape_core/  # MUST be used
grep -r "ES5\|ES6" packages/snape_core/  # Check compatibility
```

#### **For Any State Change**:
```bash
# Trace state management
grep -r "dispatch\|getState\|subscribe" public/js/*.js
grep -r "store\." public/js/core-store.js
grep -r "transition\|state" public/js/statechart-tools.js
```

edits.old_string: ## File Placement Cheatsheet
edits.new_string: ## üìä **ENTERPRISE READINESS GAPS**

edits.old_string:
- Electron main/preload/renderer for the container ‚Üí `apps/chrome-container/chrome-container-app/`
- Any HTML/CSS/JS served by a web server (no Electron) ‚Üí `apps/web/public`
- Node server and DB schema ‚Üí `packages/server/`
- Python modules (Snape) ‚Üí `packages/snape_core/`
- Dev tools and CLI utilities ‚Üí `packages/codemap-tool/`
- Screenshots, images ‚Üí `assets/`
- Scripts/diagnostics ‚Üí `scripts/`
edits.new_string:
1. **Microservices Architecture** (-30 points)
   - Monolithic structure needs service decomposition
   - API Gateway pattern missing
   - Service mesh considerations needed

2. **Testing Organization** (-40 points)
   - Tests scattered across packages/tests and inline
   - No unified test runner configuration
   - Missing coverage reports

3. **Legacy Code** (-25 points)
   - /src/frontend duplicates /apps/web functionality
   - Migration path needed

4. **Documentation Consolidation** (-20 points)
   - Reports scattered in /docs/reports/
   - No centralized API documentation

5. **Security Audit Trail** (-15 points)
   - No centralized logging
   - Missing audit middleware

edits.old_string: ## Packaging Considerations
edits.new_string: ## üéØ **IMPROVEMENT RECOMMENDATIONS**

edits.old_string:
- `apps/chrome-container/` is the Electron bundle root. Electron Builder should point to this subfolder.
- `packages/server/` runs independently (service or process) and can be started via npm/yarn scripts.
- Symlinks at the root preserve current paths so existing tooling continues to work while upgrading references.
edits.new_string:
1. **Immediate Actions** (Quick Wins):
   - Consolidate /src/frontend into /apps/web
   - Create unified test runner in /packages/tests
   - Add API documentation generator

2. **Short Term** (1-2 months):
   - Implement service layer abstraction
   - Add centralized logging service
   - Create migration scripts for legacy code

3. **Long Term** (3-6 months):
   - Decompose into microservices
   - Implement API Gateway
   - Add Kubernetes deployment configs
   - Implement distributed tracing

edits.old_string: ## Migration Notes
edits.new_string: ## üìà **METRICS FOR SUCCESS**

edits.old_string:
- This reorg moves only directories and adds symlinks; it does not modify file contents.
- After consumer scripts are updated to use new paths, the symlinks can be removed safely.
edits.new_string:
- **File Creation**: < 3 new files per feature
- **Test Coverage**: > 80% for critical paths
- **API Response Time**: < 200ms p95
- **Build Time**: < 5 minutes
- **Deployment Frequency**: > 1 per day
- **MTTR**: < 1 hour
- **Security Violations**: 0 execute_script usage

```text
apps/
```

## ‚úÖ **FILE PLACEMENT VERIFICATION CHECKLIST**

### **Before Creating ANY New File**:
- [ ] Check if existing file can be modified instead
- [ ] Verify placement follows architecture rules
- [ ] Confirm no duplicate functionality exists
- [ ] Document in CLAUDE.md if absolutely necessary

### **For Module Changes**:
- [ ] Run grep rules to find all dependencies
- [ ] Check loading order requirements
- [ ] Verify no circular dependencies created
- [ ] Test in browser after changes

### **For SNAPE Changes**:
- [ ] Verify ES5 compatibility only
- [ ] Check ActionChains usage (no execute_script)
- [ ] Test with visual feedback enabled
- [ ] Confirm unified_system.py integration

### **For IPC Changes**:
- [ ] Trace main ‚Üí renderer flow
- [ ] Verify security context maintained
- [ ] Check preload.js context bridge
- [ ] Test all IPC endpoints

---

**This architecture document serves as the single source of truth for my-web-app structure. Any deviation from these patterns MUST be justified and documented.**

toolUseResult.originalFileContents:
# MY-WEB-APP ENTERPRISE ARCHITECTURE ANALYSIS
## Enterprise Readiness Score: 72/100

### Score Breakdown:
- **Modularity**: 85/100 (Good separation with monorepo structure)
- **Scalability**: 70/100 (Needs microservices considerations)
- **Maintainability**: 65/100 (Documentation spread, needs consolidation)
- **Security**: 75/100 (Good isolation, needs audit trails)
- **Testing**: 60/100 (Tests scattered, needs unified framework)
- **DevOps**: 80/100 (Good CI/CD structure with hooks)

## Top‚ÄëLevel Layout

```mermaid
flowchart LR
  root["my-web-app/"]
  root --> apps
  root --> packages
  root --> docs
  root --> assets
  root --> scripts
  root --> tmp

  apps --> app_chrome["apps/chrome-container/"]
  apps --> app_web["apps/web/"]

  app_chrome --> cc_src[renderer + public moved inside]
  app_web --> web_public[public/]
  app_web --> web_renderer[renderer/]

  packages --> pkg_server["packages/server/"]
  packages --> pkg_snape["packages/snape_core/"]
  packages --> pkg_codemap["packages/codemap-tool/"]
  packages --> pkg_tests["packages/tests/"]

  docs --> docs_md["docs/ (guides, reports)"]
  assets --> screenshots["screenshots/" ]
  scripts --> scripts_misc["scripts/, diagnostic-backup/ (tooling)"]
```

## Directory Rules (What belongs where)

- `apps/chrome-container/`
  - Electron application for the Chrome container UI and runtime.
  - Contains app `main.js`, `preload.js`, `renderer/`, bundled `public/` for this app.
  - Only Electron‚Äëfacing code, renderers, and static assets specific to the container.

- `apps/web/`
  - Browser UI build target (plain web assets only).
  - `public/` lives here. The Chrome container's renderers live under `apps/chrome-container/chrome-container-app/renderer*`.

- `packages/server/`
  - All server/backend code, APIs and DB schemas (`server/` moved here).
  - May expose a CLI entry point (e.g., `bin/`) for local dev.

- `packages/snape_core/`
  - Python packages for Snape, actions, planning modules, tests.
  - Keep Py modules importable from this root (`__init__.py`).

- `packages/codemap-tool/`
  - Codemap analysis tool and its templates/assets.

- `packages/tests/`
  - All automated tests that are not colocated (integration/e2e, python tests, etc.).

- `docs/`
  - Architecture guides, reports, ADRs, engineering notes.

- `assets/`
  - Images, icons, design tokens. (Existing `screenshots/` moved here or linked.)

- `scripts/`
  - Developer tooling, diagnostics, packaging helpers.

## Cross‚Äëcutting Rules

1. Files must be placed where they are executed:
   - Electron app code ‚Üí `apps/chrome-container/`
   - Browser assets ‚Üí `apps/web/`
   - Node API/server ‚Üí `packages/server/`
   - Python libs ‚Üí `packages/snape_core/`
   - Tools ‚Üí `packages/<tool>/`

2. Shared assets (icons, fonts) go in `assets/` and are referenced relatively from app/package paths.

3. No code files at repo root other than orchestrators (e.g., root `package.json`, workspace config).

4. Backward compatibility: original top‚Äëlevel directories remain as symlinks to the new locations until all scripts are updated.

## Module Dependency Boundaries

```mermaid
flowchart TB
  subgraph Apps
    A1[chrome-container] --> P1((packages/server))
    A1 --> P2((packages/snape_core))
    A2[web] --> P1
  end

  subgraph Packages
    P1[server]
    P2[snape_core]
    P3[codemap-tool]
    P4[tests]
  end

  A1 -. dev tools .-> P3
  A2 -. integration tests .-> P4
```

## File Placement Cheatsheet

- Electron main/preload/renderer for the container ‚Üí `apps/chrome-container/chrome-container-app/`
- Any HTML/CSS/JS served by a web server (no Electron) ‚Üí `apps/web/public`
- Node server and DB schema ‚Üí `packages/server/`
- Python modules (Snape) ‚Üí `packages/snape_core/`
- Dev tools and CLI utilities ‚Üí `packages/codemap-tool/`
- Screenshots, images ‚Üí `assets/`
- Scripts/diagnostics ‚Üí `scripts/`

## Packaging Considerations

- `apps/chrome-container/` is the Electron bundle root. Electron Builder should point to this subfolder.
- `packages/server/` runs independently (service or process) and can be started via npm/yarn scripts.
- Symlinks at the root preserve current paths so existing tooling continues to work while upgrading references.

## Migration Notes

- This reorg moves only directories and adds symlinks; it does not modify file contents.
- After consumer scripts are updated to use new paths, the symlinks can be removed safely.

## Current Directory Inventory and Destinations

The following table reflects the repository's current folders and their ownership after reorg.

```text
apps/
  chrome-container/
    chrome-container-app/           # Electron app (owns renderer/, public/, src/, logs/, dist/, tmp/)
    tools/chrome-manager/           # Chrome manager tooling for Electron app
  web/
    public/                         # Website-only assets

assets/
  screenshots/                      # Runtime screenshots
  debug_output/                     # Runtime debug captures

packages/
  server/                           # Node server & DB
  snape_core/                       # Python Snape modules
  codemap-tool/                     # Codemap CLI/tooling
  tests/                            # non-colocated tests

scripts/
  diagnostic-backup/                # diagnostic scripts

src/                                # Legacy source tree (kept for now)
  assets/ css/ frontend/ js/        # to be merged into apps/web or packages/server in next pass

chrome-container-app -> apps/chrome-container/chrome-container-app (legacy path kept for compatibility only)
```

I've completed a comprehensive enterprise architecture analysis of your my-web-app project with a detailed Mermaid diagram and extensive documentation. Here are the key highlights:

## **Enterprise Readiness Score: 72/100**

### **Score Breakdown:**
- **Modularity**: 85/100 (Good monorepo structure)
- **Scalability**: 70/100 (Needs microservices)
- **Maintainability**: 65/100 (Documentation scattered)
- **Security**: 75/100 (Good isolation)
- **Testing**: 60/100 (Tests need unification)
- **DevOps**: 80/100 (Good CI/CD with hooks)

### **Key Architectural Features:**

1. **Comprehensive Mermaid Diagram**: Shows every major file with:
   - Current connections and dependencies
   - Grep rules for tracing changes
   - Enterprise readiness scores per module
   - Color-coded by quality (green=good, orange=moderate, red=poor)

2. **Critical File Placement Rules**:
   - **Load Order Enforcement** for web JS files (types ‚Üí store ‚Üí utils)
   - **IPC Security Boundaries** in Electron app
   - **ES5-only enforcement** for SNAPE automation
   - **Single entry points** for each subsystem

3. **End-to-End Grep Rules** for:
   - Canvas changes
   - IPC communication
   - SNAPE automation
   - State management

4. **Enterprise Gaps Identified**:
   - Missing microservices architecture (-30 points)
   - Scattered testing framework (-40 points)
   - Legacy code duplication (-25 points)
   - Documentation fragmentation (-20 points)
   - No audit trail system (-15 points)

5. **Improvement Roadmap**:
   - **Immediate**: Consolidate legacy code, unify tests
   - **Short-term**: Add service abstractions, logging
   - **Long-term**: Microservices, API Gateway, Kubernetes

The document now serves as a complete architectural reference with actionable grep commands for any code changes, ensuring end-to-end traceability and enterprise-level documentation standards.

content.content:
1‚Üí# Task: Convert Project Rules to Claude Code Hooks
     2‚Üí
     3‚ÜíYou are an expert at converting natural language project rules into Claude Code hook configurations. Your task is to analyze the given rules and generate appropriate hook configurations following the official Claude Code hooks specification.
     4‚Üí
     5‚Üí## Instructions
     6‚Üí
     7‚Üí1. If rules are provided as arguments, analyze those rules
     8‚Üí2. If no arguments are provided, read and analyze the CLAUDE.md file from these locations:
     9‚Üí   - `./CLAUDE.md` (project memory)
    10‚Üí   - `./CLAUDE.local.md` (local project memory)  
    11‚Üí   - `~/.claude/CLAUDE.md` (user memory)
    12‚Üí
    13‚Üí3. For each rule, determine:
    14‚Üí   - The appropriate hook event (PreToolUse, PostToolUse, Stop, Notification, UserPromptSubmit, SubagentStop, PreCompact, SessionStart)
    15‚Üí   - The tool matcher pattern (exact tool names or regex)
    16‚Üí   - The command to execute
    17‚Üí
    18‚Üí4. Generate the complete hook configuration following the exact JSON structure
    19‚Üí5. Save it to the appropriate settings file (merge with existing hooks if present):
    20‚Üí   - `~/.claude/settings.json` (User settings)
    21‚Üí   - `.claude/settings.json` (Project settings)
    22‚Üí   - `.claude/settings.local.json` (Local project settings)
    23‚Üí6. Provide a summary of what was configured
    24‚Üí
    25‚Üí## Hook Events
    26‚Üí
    27‚Üí### PreToolUse
    28‚Üí- **When**: Runs BEFORE a tool is executed
    29‚Üí- **Common Keywords**: "before", "check", "validate", "prevent", "scan", "verify"
    30‚Üí- **Available Tool Matchers**: 
    31‚Üí  - `Task` - Before launching agent tasks
    32‚Üí  - `Bash` - Before running shell commands
    33‚Üí  - `Glob` - Before file pattern matching
    34‚Üí  - `Grep` - Before content searching
    35‚Üí  - `Read` - Before reading files
    36‚Üí  - `Edit` - Before editing single files
    37‚Üí  - `MultiEdit` - Before batch editing files
    38‚Üí  - `Write` - Before writing/creating files
    39‚Üí  - `WebFetch` - Before fetching web content
    40‚Üí  - `WebSearch` - Before web searching
    41‚Üí  - MCP tools (pattern: `mcp__<server>__<tool>`)
    42‚Üí- **Special Feature**: Can block tool execution if command returns non-zero exit code
    43‚Üí
    44‚Üí### PostToolUse
    45‚Üí- **When**: Runs AFTER a tool completes successfully
    46‚Üí- **Common Keywords**: "after", "following", "once done", "when finished"
    47‚Üí- **Available Tool Matchers**: Same as PreToolUse
    48‚Üí- **Common Uses**: Formatting, linting, building, testing after file changes
    49‚Üí
    50‚Üí### Stop
    51‚Üí- **When**: Runs when Claude Code finishes responding
    52‚Üí- **Common Keywords**: "finish", "complete", "end task", "done", "wrap up"
    53‚Üí- **No matcher needed**: Applies to all completions
    54‚Üí- **Common Uses**: Final status checks, summaries, cleanup
    55‚Üí
    56‚Üí### Notification
    57‚Üí- **When**: Runs when Claude Code sends notifications
    58‚Üí- **Common Keywords**: "notify", "alert", "inform", "message"
    59‚Üí- **Special**: Rarely used for rule conversion
    60‚Üí- **Triggers**: When Claude needs permission or when input is idle for 60+ seconds
    61‚Üí
    62‚Üí### UserPromptSubmit
    63‚Üí- **When**: Runs when user submits a prompt, before Claude processes it
    64‚Üí- **Common Keywords**: "before prompt", "validate input", "add context", "check prompt"
    65‚Üí- **No matcher needed**: Applies to all user prompts
    66‚Üí- **Common Uses**: Adding context, validating prompts, blocking certain types of prompts
    67‚Üí- **Special**: Can add additional context or block prompt processing
    68‚Üí
    69‚Üí### SubagentStop
    70‚Üí- **When**: Runs when a Claude Code subagent (Task tool call) finishes responding
    71‚Üí- **Common Keywords**: "subagent done", "task complete", "agent finished"
    72‚Üí- **No matcher needed**: Applies to all subagent completions
    73‚Üí- **Common Uses**: Cleanup after subagent tasks, status reporting
    74‚Üí
    75‚Üí### PreCompact
    76‚Üí- **When**: Runs before Claude Code compacts conversation history
    77‚Üí- **Common Keywords**: "before compact", "cleanup before compress"
    78‚Üí- **Available Matchers**:
    79‚Üí  - `manual` - Invoked from `/compact` command
    80‚Üí  - `auto` - Invoked automatically due to full context window
    81‚Üí- **Common Uses**: Save important context before compression
    82‚Üí
    83‚Üí### SessionStart
    84‚Üí- **When**: Runs when Claude Code starts a new session or resumes existing one
    85‚Üí- **Common Keywords**: "on startup", "session begin", "initialize"
    86‚Üí- **Available Matchers**:
    87‚Üí  - `startup` - Invoked from startup
    88‚Üí  - `resume` - Invoked from `--resume`, `--continue`, or `/resume`
    89‚Üí  - `clear` - Invoked from `/clear`
    90‚Üí- **Common Uses**: Loading development context, setting up environment
    91‚Üí
    92‚Üí## Hook Configuration Structure
    93‚Üí
    94‚Üí```json
    95‚Üí{
    96‚Üí  "hooks": {
    97‚Üí    "EventName": [
    98‚Üí      {
    99‚Üí        "matcher": "ToolName|AnotherTool|Pattern.*",
   100‚Üí        "hooks": [
   101‚Üí          {
   102‚Üí            "type": "command",
   103‚Üí            "command": "your-command-here",
   104‚Üí            "timeout": 60
   105‚Üí          }
   106‚Üí        ]
   107‚Üí      }
   108‚Üí    ]
   109‚Üí  }
   110‚Üí}
   111‚Üí```
   112‚Üí
   113‚ÜíFor events without matchers (UserPromptSubmit, Stop, SubagentStop, Notification):
   114‚Üí```json
   115‚Üí{
   116‚Üí  "hooks": {
   117‚Üí    "EventName": [
   118‚Üí      {
   119‚Üí        "hooks": [
   120‚Üí          {
   121‚Üí            "type": "command",
   122‚Üí            "command": "your-command-here"
   123‚Üí          }
   124‚Üí        ]
   125‚Üí      }
   126‚Üí    ]
   127‚Üí  }
   128‚Üí}
   129‚Üí```
   130‚Üí
   131‚Üí## Matcher Patterns
   132‚Üí
   133‚Üí- **Exact match**: `"Edit"` - matches only Edit tool
   134‚Üí- **Multiple tools**: `"Edit|MultiEdit|Write"` - matches any of these
   135‚Üí- **Regex patterns**: `".*Edit"` - matches Edit and MultiEdit
   136‚Üí- **All tools**: Omit matcher field entirely or use `"*"` or `""`
   137‚Üí- **MCP tools**: `"mcp__memory__.*"` (all memory server tools) or `"mcp__.*__write.*"` (all write operations)
   138‚Üí
   139‚Üí## Examples with Analysis
   140‚Üí
   141‚Üí### Example 1: Python Formatting
   142‚Üí**Rule**: "Format Python files with black after editing"
   143‚Üí**Analysis**: 
   144‚Üí- Keyword "after" ‚Üí PostToolUse
   145‚Üí- "editing" ‚Üí Edit|MultiEdit|Write tools
   146‚Üí- "Python files" ‚Üí command should target .py files
   147‚Üí
   148‚Üí```json
   149‚Üí{
   150‚Üí  "hooks": {
   151‚Üí    "PostToolUse": [{
   152‚Üí      "matcher": "Edit|MultiEdit|Write",
   153‚Üí      "hooks": [{
   154‚Üí        "type": "command",
   155‚Üí        "command": "black . --quiet 2>/dev/null || true"
   156‚Üí      }]
   157‚Üí    }]
   158‚Üí  }
   159‚Üí}
   160‚Üí```
   161‚Üí
   162‚Üí### Example 2: Git Status Check
   163‚Üí**Rule**: "Run git status when finishing a task"
   164‚Üí**Analysis**:
   165‚Üí- "finishing" ‚Üí Stop event
   166‚Üí- No specific tool mentioned ‚Üí no matcher needed
   167‚Üí
   168‚Üí```json
   169‚Üí{
   170‚Üí  "hooks": {
   171‚Üí    "Stop": [{
   172‚Üí      "hooks": [{
   173‚Üí        "type": "command",
   174‚Üí        "command": "git status"
   175‚Üí      }]
   176‚Üí    }]
   177‚Üí  }
   178‚Üí}
   179‚Üí```
   180‚Üí
   181‚Üí### Example 3: Security Scan
   182‚Üí**Rule**: "Check for hardcoded secrets before saving any file"
   183‚Üí**Analysis**:
   184‚Üí- "before" ‚Üí PreToolUse
   185‚Üí- "saving any file" ‚Üí Write|Edit|MultiEdit
   186‚Üí
   187‚Üí```json
   188‚Üí{
   189‚Üí  "hooks": {
   190‚Üí    "PreToolUse": [{
   191‚Üí      "matcher": "Write|Edit|MultiEdit",
   192‚Üí      "hooks": [{
   193‚Üí        "type": "command",
   194‚Üí        "command": "git secrets --scan 2>/dev/null || echo 'No secrets found'"
   195‚Üí      }]
   196‚Üí    }]
   197‚Üí  }
   198‚Üí}
   199‚Üí```
   200‚Üí
   201‚Üí### Example 4: Test Runner
   202‚Üí**Rule**: "Run npm test after modifying files in tests/ directory"
   203‚Üí**Analysis**:
   204‚Üí- "after modifying" ‚Üí PostToolUse
   205‚Üí- "files" ‚Üí Edit|MultiEdit|Write
   206‚Üí- Note: Path filtering happens in the command, not the matcher
   207‚Üí
   208‚Üí```json
   209‚Üí{
   210‚Üí  "hooks": {
   211‚Üí    "PostToolUse": [{
   212‚Üí      "matcher": "Edit|MultiEdit|Write",
   213‚Üí      "hooks": [{
   214‚Üí        "type": "command",
   215‚Üí        "command": "npm test 2>/dev/null || echo 'Tests need attention'"
   216‚Üí      }]
   217‚Üí    }]
   218‚Üí  }
   219‚Üí}
   220‚Üí```
   221‚Üí
   222‚Üí### Example 5: Command Logging
   223‚Üí**Rule**: "Log all bash commands before execution"
   224‚Üí**Analysis**:
   225‚Üí- "before execution" ‚Üí PreToolUse
   226‚Üí- "bash commands" ‚Üí Bash tool specifically
   227‚Üí
   228‚Üí```json
   229‚Üí{
   230‚Üí  "hooks": {
   231‚Üí    "PreToolUse": [{
   232‚Üí      "matcher": "Bash",
   233‚Üí      "hooks": [{
   234‚Üí        "type": "command",
   235‚Üí        "command": "echo \"[$(date)] Executing bash command\" >> ~/.claude/command.log"
   236‚Üí      }]
   237‚Üí    }]
   238‚Üí  }
   239‚Üí}
   240‚Üí```
   241‚Üí
   242‚Üí### Example 6: Session Context Loading
   243‚Üí**Rule**: "Load recent git changes when starting a new session"
   244‚Üí**Analysis**:
   245‚Üí- "starting a new session" ‚Üí SessionStart
   246‚Üí- No specific matcher needed
   247‚Üí
   248‚Üí```json
   249‚Üí{
   250‚Üí  "hooks": {
   251‚Üí    "SessionStart": [{
   252‚Üí      "hooks": [{
   253‚Üí        "type": "command",
   254‚Üí        "command": "git log --oneline -10 > /tmp/recent_changes.txt && echo 'Recent changes loaded'"
   255‚Üí      }]
   256‚Üí    }]
   257‚Üí  }
   258‚Üí}
   259‚Üí```
   260‚Üí
   261‚Üí### Example 7: Prompt Validation
   262‚Üí**Rule**: "Check for sensitive information before processing user prompts"
   263‚Üí**Analysis**:
   264‚Üí- "before processing" ‚Üí UserPromptSubmit
   265‚Üí- No matcher needed for prompt events
   266‚Üí
   267‚Üí```json
   268‚Üí{
   269‚Üí  "hooks": {
   270‚Üí    "UserPromptSubmit": [{
   271‚Üí      "hooks": [{
   272‚Üí        "type": "command",
   273‚Üí        "command": "$CLAUDE_PROJECT_DIR/.claude/scripts/check-sensitive.py"
   274‚Üí      }]
   275‚Üí    }]
   276‚Üí  }
   277‚Üí}
   278‚Üí```
   279‚Üí
   280‚Üí## Hook Input and Output
   281‚Üí
   282‚Üí### Hook Input
   283‚ÜíHooks receive JSON data via stdin containing:
   284‚Üí- `session_id`: Unique session identifier
   285‚Üí- `transcript_path`: Path to conversation JSON file
   286‚Üí- `cwd`: Current working directory
   287‚Üí- `hook_event_name`: Name of the triggering event
   288‚Üí- Event-specific fields (e.g., `tool_name`, `tool_input`, `prompt`)
   289‚Üí
   290‚Üí### Hook Output Options
   291‚Üí
   292‚Üí#### Simple: Exit Codes
   293‚Üí- **Exit code 0**: Success, stdout shown to user (or added to context for UserPromptSubmit/SessionStart)
   294‚Üí- **Exit code 2**: Blocking error, stderr fed back to Claude automatically
   295‚Üí- **Other codes**: Non-blocking error, stderr shown to user
   296‚Üí
   297‚Üí#### Advanced: JSON Output
   298‚ÜíFor sophisticated control, output JSON to stdout:
   299‚Üí```json
   300‚Üí{
   301‚Üí  "continue": true,
   302‚Üí  "stopReason": "Optional message when continue is false",
   303‚Üí  "suppressOutput": false,
   304‚Üí  "decision": "block|approve|ask",
   305‚Üí  "reason": "Explanation for decision",
   306‚Üí  "hookSpecificOutput": {
   307‚Üí    "hookEventName": "UserPromptSubmit",
   308‚Üí    "additionalContext": "Context to add",
   309‚Üí    "permissionDecision": "allow|deny|ask",
   310‚Üí    "permissionDecisionReason": "Reason for permission decision"
   311‚Üí  }
   312‚Üí}
   313‚Üí```
   314‚Üí
   315‚Üí## Working with MCP Tools
   316‚Üí
   317‚ÜíMCP (Model Context Protocol) tools follow the pattern `mcp__<server>__<tool>`:
   318‚Üí- `mcp__memory__create_entities` - Memory server's create entities tool
   319‚Üí- `mcp__filesystem__read_file` - Filesystem server's read file tool
   320‚Üí- `mcp__github__search_repositories` - GitHub server's search tool
   321‚Üí
   322‚ÜíExample MCP hook configuration:
   323‚Üí```json
   324‚Üí{
   325‚Üí  "hooks": {
   326‚Üí    "PreToolUse": [{
   327‚Üí      "matcher": "mcp__memory__.*",
   328‚Üí      "hooks": [{
   329‚Üí        "type": "command",
   330‚Üí        "command": "echo 'Memory operation initiated' >> ~/mcp-operations.log"
   331‚Üí      }]
   332‚Üí    }]
   333‚Üí  }
   334‚Üí}
   335‚Üí```
   336‚Üí
   337‚Üí## Environment Variables
   338‚Üí
   339‚Üí- `CLAUDE_PROJECT_DIR`: Absolute path to project root directory
   340‚Üí- Use for project-specific scripts: `$CLAUDE_PROJECT_DIR/.claude/hooks/script.sh`
   341‚Üí
   342‚Üí## Hook Execution Details
   343‚Üí
   344‚Üí- **Timeout**: 60 seconds default (configurable per command)
   345‚Üí- **Parallelization**: All matching hooks run in parallel
   346‚Üí- **Environment**: Runs with Claude Code's environment and user permissions
   347‚Üí- **Progress**: Shown in transcript mode (Ctrl-R) for PreToolUse/PostToolUse/Stop
   348‚Üí
   349‚Üí## Best Practices for Command Generation
   350‚Üí
   351‚Üí1. **Error Handling**: Add `|| true` or `2>/dev/null` to prevent hook failures from blocking Claude
   352‚Üí2. **Quiet Mode**: Use quiet flags (--quiet, -q) when available
   353‚Üí3. **Path Safety**: Use absolute paths with `$CLAUDE_PROJECT_DIR` for project scripts
   354‚Üí4. **Performance**: Keep commands fast to avoid slowing down Claude (60s timeout)
   355‚Üí5. **Logging**: Redirect verbose output to avoid cluttering Claude's interface
   356‚Üí6. **Security**: Validate and sanitize inputs, avoid destructive operations
   357‚Üí7. **Quoting**: Always quote shell variables: `"$VAR"` not `$VAR`
   358‚Üí
   359‚Üí## Common Rule Patterns
   360‚Üí
   361‚Üí- "Format [language] files after editing" ‚Üí PostToolUse + Edit|MultiEdit|Write
   362‚Üí- "Run [command] before committing" ‚Üí PreToolUse + Bash (when git commit detected)
   363‚Üí- "Check for [pattern] before saving" ‚Üí PreToolUse + Write|Edit|MultiEdit
   364‚Üí- "Execute [command] when done" ‚Üí Stop event
   365‚Üí- "Validate [something] before running commands" ‚Üí PreToolUse + Bash
   366‚Üí- "Clear cache after modifying config" ‚Üí PostToolUse + Edit|MultiEdit|Write
   367‚Üí- "Notify when [condition]" ‚Üí Usually PostToolUse with specific matcher
   368‚Üí- "Load context on startup" ‚Üí SessionStart event
   369‚Üí- "Validate user input" ‚Üí UserPromptSubmit event
   370‚Üí- "Cleanup after subagent tasks" ‚Üí SubagentStop event
   371‚Üí- "Save state before compact" ‚Üí PreCompact event
   372‚Üí- "Monitor MCP operations" ‚Üí PreToolUse/PostToolUse + mcp__.*
   373‚Üí
   374‚Üí## Important Notes
   375‚Üí
   376‚Üí1. Always merge with existing hooks - don't overwrite
   377‚Üí2. Test commands work before adding to hooks  
   378‚Üí3. Consider performance impact of hooks (60s timeout per command)
   379‚Üí4. Use specific matchers when possible to avoid unnecessary executions
   380‚Üí5. Commands run with full user permissions - be careful with destructive operations
   381‚Üí6. Hook configuration changes don't take effect until Claude Code restart
   382‚Üí7. Use `/hooks` command to verify hook registration
   383‚Üí8. All matching hooks run in parallel
   384‚Üí9. For debugging, use `claude --debug` to see hook execution details
   385‚Üí
   386‚Üí## Configuration Safety
   387‚Üí
   388‚ÜíDirect edits to settings files don't take effect immediately. Claude Code:
   389‚Üí1. Captures hook snapshot at startup
   390‚Üí2. Uses snapshot throughout session
   391‚Üí3. Warns if hooks are modified externally
   392‚Üí4. Requires review in `/hooks` menu for changes to apply
   393‚Üí
   394‚Üí## Security Considerations
   395‚Üí
   396‚Üí**WARNING**: Hooks execute arbitrary shell commands with full user permissions. Always:
   397‚Üí- Review and test commands before deployment
   398‚Üí- Validate inputs to prevent injection attacks
   399‚Üí- Use absolute paths for security
   400‚Üí- Avoid modifying sensitive files
   401‚Üí- Test in safe environments first
   402‚Üí
   403‚ÜíAnthropic provides no warranty for hook usage - use at your own risk.
