| `.filter-btn` | Sets the visual state for the error filter. | `app.js:79` | `addEventListener` -> `setErrorFilter(...)` (line `264`) | The clicked button gets the `.active` class. No data filtering is implemented in the renderer. |
| `#new-terminal-btn` | Requests a new terminal instance from the backend. | `app.js:55` | `connectButton` -> `window.electronAPI.createTerminal` | Disables the button during the API call and logs the result to the console. |
| `#split-terminal-btn` | Requests to split the terminal view in the backend. | `app.js:56` | `connectButton` -> `window.electronAPI.splitTerminal` | Disables the button during the API call and logs the result to the console. |
| `#terminal-dropdown-btn` | Toggles the visibility of the terminal options dropdown. | `app.js:57` | `connectButton` -> `handleTerminalDropdown` (line `208`) | The dropdown menu is shown or hidden. |
| `.dropdown-item[data-action]` | Executes a terminal action from the dropdown menu. | `app.js:84` | `addEventListener` -> `handleDropdownAction(...)` (line `215`) | The corresponding `electronAPI` function for the selected action is called. |
| **Footer & Modals** | | | |
| `#connection-manager-toggle` | Toggles the visibility of the Connection Manager modal. | `app.js:60` | `connectButton` -> `toggleModal(...)` (line `257`) | The modal is shown or hidden. |
| `#close-connection-modal` | Closes the Connection Manager modal. | `app.js:61` | `connectButton` -> `hideModal(...)` (line `261`) | The modal is hidden. |
| `#close-modal` | Closes the File Preview modal. | `app.js:62` | `connectButton` -> `hideModal(...)` (line `261`) | The modal is hidden. |
| `#clear-sessions` | Requests the backend to clear all active sessions. | `app.js:63` | `connectButton` -> `window.electronAPI.clearSessions` | Disables the button during the API call and logs the result to the console. |
| `#refresh-status` | Manually triggers a poll for fresh data from the backend. | `app.js:64` | `connectButton` -> `startLivePolling` (line `123`) | The live polling function is called immediately to fetch new data. |
| `#export-logs` | Requests the backend to export all logs. | `app.js:65` | `connectButton` -> `window.electronAPI.exportLogs` | Disables the button during the API call and logs the result to the console. |
| `#force-kill-websockets` | Requests the backend to kill all WebSocket connections. | `app.js:66` | `connectButton` -> `window.electronAPI.forceKillWebsockets` | Disables the button during the API call and logs the result to the console. |
| `#restart-websocket-server` | Requests the backend to restart the WebSocket server. | `app.js:67` | `connectButton` -> `window.electronAPI.restartWebsocketServer` | Disables the button during the API call and logs the result to the console. |

lines: ## Chrome Container App - Universal Interface Documentation

-This document defines the **complete behavioral contract** for every interactive DOM element across all interfaces within the Chrome Container App ecosystem. It includes comprehensive expectations for function calls, snowball action chains, and UI state management for every menu, toolbar, modal, window, and interface component.

+**GREP INSTRUCTION FOR AGENTS:** `grep -r "getElementById\|querySelector" apps/chrome-container/chrome-container-app/ --include="*.js" --include="*.html" | grep -E "(element-id-from-table)" | head -5` - Use this to trace all files that interact with any DOM element from the tables below.

+This document defines the **complete behavioral contract** for every interactive DOM element across all interfaces within the Chrome Container App ecosystem. Each DOM element has dedicated tables showing expectations, snowball actions, and file dependencies.

# COMPREHENSIVE DOM EXPECTATIONS & FUNCTION MAPPING
## Chrome Container App - Universal Interface Documentation

**GREP INSTRUCTION FOR AGENTS:** `grep -r "getElementById\|querySelector" apps/chrome-container/chrome-container-app/ --include="*.js" --include="*.html" | grep -E "(element-id-from-table)" | head -5` - Use this to trace all files that interact with any DOM element from the tables below.

This document defines the **complete behavioral contract** for every interactive DOM element across all interfaces within the Chrome Container App ecosystem. Each DOM element has dedicated tables showing expectations, snowball actions, and file dependencies.

## üèóÔ∏è **ARCHITECTURE OVERVIEW**

### **Interface Hierarchy:**
```
chrome-container-app/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ renderer/index.html          # Main Chrome Container Interface
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ public/index.html            # Curatated Social Discovery Interface  
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ public/canvas.html           # TLDraw Canvas Editor Interface
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ public/auth.html             # Authentication Interface
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ public/profile.html          # User Profile Interface
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ public/strike-errors.html    # Strike Errors Analysis Interface
```

### **Universal Trace & Validation Contract:**

**All interactions across ALL interfaces MUST produce these trace events:**
- `invoke:start | invoke:success | invoke:error` for each `ipcRenderer.invoke`
- `ui:click` for every clickable element with `ui:action-success | ui:action-error`
- `ui:gesture:start | move | end` for all drag/resize operations with metrics
- `ui:state-change` for visibility toggles, theme changes, tab switches
- `renderer:init` when each interface initializes
- `renderer:ready` when all subscriptions established
- `renderer:error` for any runtime failures

## üéØ **INTERFACE 1: MAIN CHROME CONTAINER** (`renderer/index.html`)

### **HEADER SECTION** 
**Layout:** `header.header` containing brand, controls, and status indicators

| Element ID | Description | Function Chain | Expected UI State | Snowball Actions |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| `#header-toggle-left` | Toggle left sidebar visibility | `toggleToolbar('leftToolbar')` | Sidebar slides in/out, arrow rotates, main content adjusts width | ‚Üí Updates layout classes ‚Üí Triggers resize events ‚Üí Saves state to localStorage |
| `#header-toggle-right` | Toggle right sidebar visibility | `toggleToolbar('rightToolbar')` | Sidebar slides in/out, arrow rotates, terminal content reflows | ‚Üí Updates layout classes ‚Üí Triggers resize events ‚Üí Saves state to localStorage |
| `#header-reset-layout` | Reset all panel sizes to default | `resetLayoutSizing()` | All panels return to default widths, clears custom sizing | ‚Üí Removes inline styles ‚Üí Resets CSS variables ‚Üí Triggers layout recalc |
| `#header-screenshot-btn` | Global screenshot capture | `connectButton` ‚Üí `window.electronAPI.takeScreenshot` | Button disables 500ms, loading state, success notification | ‚Üí IPC call ‚Üí File save ‚Üí UI notification ‚Üí Counter update ‚Üí Gallery refresh |

**Status Indicators (Read-only but state-reactive):**
- `#chrome-status`: Chrome connection state with color-coded icons
- `#connection-status`: Active connection count with live updates  
- `.status-icon`: Visual state indicators that change color/symbol based on backend status

### **LEFT TOOLBAR** (`aside.left-toolbar`)
**Sections:** Strike Errors + AI File Browser + Mermaid Diagrams

#### **Strike Errors Section**
| Element ID | Description | Function Chain | Expected UI State | Snowball Actions |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| `#launch-strike-errors` | Launch AI code analysis | `connectButton` ‚Üí `window.electronAPI.strikeErrorsOpen` | Button disabled, progress bar appears, status dot changes to analyzing | ‚Üí Opens Strike Errors window ‚Üí Initializes analysis ‚Üí Updates progress UI ‚Üí Streams results |
| `#upload-files` | Directory selection for analysis | `connectButton` ‚Üí `window.electronAPI.openDirectory` | File dialog opens, loading state on selection | ‚Üí File browser ‚Üí Directory scan ‚Üí File tree population ‚Üí AI path analysis ‚Üí Confidence scoring |
| `#strikeStatusDot` | Visual status indicator | Updates via backend events | Color changes: gray(ready) ‚Üí orange(analyzing) ‚Üí green(complete) ‚Üí red(error) | ‚Üí Status text updates ‚Üí Progress visibility ‚Üí Health scores appear |
| `#strikeProgress` | Analysis progress display | Controlled by analysis events | Hidden ‚Üí Visible with animated progress bar ‚Üí Auto-hide on completion | ‚Üí Progress fill animation ‚Üí Percentage text ‚Üí ETA calculations |
| `#healthScores` | Analysis results grid | Populated by analysis completion | Hidden ‚Üí Slides in with score animations ‚Üí Color-coded results | ‚Üí Score animations ‚Üí Hover tooltips ‚Üí Detailed breakdown modal trigger |

#### **AI File Browser Section**
| Element ID | Description | Function Chain | Expected UI State | Snowball Actions |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| `#uploadStatus` | File upload progress display | Updates during directory scanning | Shows file count, confidence percentage | ‚Üí Real-time counter updates ‚Üí Confidence badge color changes ‚Üí Progress indication |
| `#directoryTree` | Hierarchical file structure | Populated by AI analysis | Empty state ‚Üí Loading ‚Üí Tree structure with icons | ‚Üí Expandable nodes ‚Üí File previews ‚Üí AI suggestions ‚Üí Path intelligence |
| `#pathSuggestions` | AI-powered path recommendations | Generated by analysis completion | Hidden ‚Üí Slides in with suggested paths and confidence scores | ‚Üí Clickable suggestions ‚Üí Path validation ‚Üí Auto-completion ‚Üí Integration recommendations |

#### **Mermaid Diagram Section**
| Element ID | Description | Function Chain | Expected UI State | Snowball Actions |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| `#diagramType` | Diagram type selector | Dropdown selection updates internal state | Updates selected option, enables generate button | ‚Üí Validates data compatibility ‚Üí Updates example preview ‚Üí Enables/disables options |
| `#generateDiagram` | Create diagram from analysis | `connectButton` ‚Üí `handleGenerateDiagram` | Loading state, then diagram renders or shows error | ‚Üí Data processing ‚Üí Mermaid rendering ‚Üí Interactive diagram ‚Üí Export options ‚Üí Zoom/pan controls |
| `#diagramContainer` | Rendered diagram display area | Populated by generation process | Empty state ‚Üí Loading ‚Üí Interactive diagram with controls | ‚Üí Zoom controls ‚Üí Export buttons ‚Üí Fullscreen mode ‚Üí Edit mode trigger |

### **CENTRAL CHROME VIEWPORT** (`section.chrome-viewport`)
**Purpose:** Universal interface container with embedded webview

| Element ID | Description | Function Chain | Expected UI State | Snowball Actions |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| `#initialize-chrome` | Start Chrome connection | `connectButton` ‚Üí `window.electronAPI.initializeChrome` | Button disabled, status changes to "Connecting" | ‚Üí Chrome process spawn ‚Üí Debug port connection ‚Üí Status updates ‚Üí Webview activation |
| `#restart-chrome` | Restart Chrome instance | `connectButton` ‚Üí `window.electronAPI.restartChrome` | Button disabled, status changes to "Restarting" | ‚Üí Process kill ‚Üí Cleanup ‚Üí Respawn ‚Üí Reconnection ‚Üí State restoration |
| `#navigate-canvas` | Navigate to canvas interface | `connectButton` ‚Üí `window.electronAPI.navigateCanvas` | Button disabled, webview shows loading | ‚Üí URL navigation ‚Üí Canvas interface load ‚Üí Tool initialization ‚Üí State sync |
| `#refresh-webview` | Reload webview content | `connectButton` ‚Üí `document.getElementById('chrome-viewport')?.reload()` | Webview reloads, temporary loading state | ‚Üí Content refresh ‚Üí State reset ‚Üí Event re-binding ‚Üí UI reinitialization |
| `#chrome-viewport` | Main content webview | Controlled by Chrome connection | Loading ‚Üí Connected ‚Üí Interactive content | ‚Üí Page loads ‚Üí Tools activate ‚Üí Events bridge ‚Üí Screenshots possible |

### **RIGHT TOOLBAR** (`aside.right-toolbar`)
**Sections:** Tab-based interface with Planning, Messages, Errors, Terminal

#### **Tab Navigation System**
| Element Class | Description | Function Chain | Expected UI State | Snowball Actions |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| `.tab-btn[data-tab="planning"]` | Switch to planning tab | `switchTab('planning')` | Active state, planning content visible | ‚Üí Hides other tabs ‚Üí Shows planning section ‚Üí Updates breadcrumb ‚Üí Loads recent files |
| `.tab-btn[data-tab="messages"]` | Switch to messages tab | `switchTab('messages')` | Active state, message interface visible | ‚Üí Shows message compose ‚Üí Loads queued messages ‚Üí Enables send controls |
| `.tab-btn[data-tab="errors"]` | Switch to error logs tab | `switchTab('errors')` | Active state, error monitoring visible | ‚Üí Shows error filters ‚Üí Loads recent errors ‚Üí Activates real-time updates |
| `.tab-btn[data-tab="terminal"]` | Switch to terminal tab | `switchTab('terminal')` | Active state, terminal interface visible | ‚Üí Activates terminal ‚Üí Shows command input ‚Üí Connects to backend |

#### **Planning Tab Content**
| Element ID | Description | Function Chain | Expected UI State | Snowball Actions |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| `#import-md` | Import markdown files | `connectButton` ‚Üí `window.electronAPI.importMdFile` | File dialog opens, processing on selection | ‚Üí File dialog ‚Üí Content parsing ‚Üí Preview generation ‚Üí File list update ‚Üí Guidance display |
| `#take-screenshot` | Capture current view | `connectButton` ‚Üí `window.electronAPI.takeScreenshot` | Button disabled, capture animation | ‚Üí Screen capture ‚Üí File save ‚Üí Thumbnail generation ‚Üí Gallery append ‚Üí Counter update |
| `#clear-screenshots` | Remove all screenshots | `connectButton` ‚Üí `window.electronAPI.clearScreenshots` | Confirmation dialog, then cleanup | ‚Üí Confirmation ‚Üí File deletion ‚Üí Gallery clear ‚Üí Counter reset ‚Üí Placeholder restore |
| `#imported-files` | File list container | Populated by import actions | Empty ‚Üí File items with status indicators | ‚Üí File icons ‚Üí Preview buttons ‚Üí Status badges ‚Üí Action menus |
| `#guidance-content` | Markdown preview area | Updated by file imports | Empty ‚Üí Formatted markdown content | ‚Üí Syntax highlighting ‚Üí Link parsing ‚Üí Image embedding ‚Üí Scroll to sections |
| `#screenshots-list` | Screenshot gallery | Updated by capture events | Empty state ‚Üí Thumbnail grid with hover controls | ‚Üí Thumbnail generation ‚Üí Hover preview ‚Üí Delete buttons ‚Üí Fullscreen view ‚Üí Export options |
| `#screenshot-count` | Image counter display | Updates with screenshot events | Shows current count with grammar-aware pluralization | ‚Üí Count animation ‚Üí Color changes based on quantity ‚Üí Storage warning states |

#### **Messages Tab Content**
| Element ID | Description | Function Chain | Expected UI State | Snowball Actions |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| `#message-type` | Message priority selector | Updates compose context | Changes placeholder text and button styles | ‚Üí Updates send button appearance ‚Üí Changes validation rules ‚Üí Affects routing priority |
| `#message-content` | Message composition area | Real-time input validation | Auto-resize, character count, validation feedback | ‚Üí Character counting ‚Üí Auto-save drafts ‚Üí Validation highlighting ‚Üí Send button state |
| `#send-message` | Send message to backend | `connectButton` ‚Üí `handleSendMessage` | Button disabled, message queued | ‚Üí IPC message ‚Üí Backend routing ‚Üí Confirmation ‚Üí Clear input ‚Üí Success notification |
| `#queue-message` | Add to local message queue | `connectButton` ‚Üí `handleQueueMessage` | Message added to visual queue | ‚Üí Local storage ‚Üí Queue display update ‚Üí Clear input ‚Üí Batch send option |
| `#urgent-message` | Send high-priority message | `connectButton` ‚Üí `handleUrgentMessage` | Special styling, immediate send | ‚Üí Priority routing ‚Üí Immediate IPC ‚Üí Alert styling ‚Üí Clear input ‚Üí Acknowledgment required |
| `#queued-messages` | Local message queue display | Updated by queue actions | Empty ‚Üí Message list with timestamps and priority indicators | ‚Üí Message bubbles ‚Üí Timestamp formatting ‚Üí Priority badges ‚Üí Batch actions ‚Üí Individual delete |

#### **Error Logs Tab Content**
| Element ID | Description | Function Chain | Expected UI State | Snowball Actions |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| `#clear-errors` | Clear all error logs | `connectButton` ‚Üí `window.electronAPI.clearErrors` | Confirmation, then clear animation | ‚Üí Confirmation dialog ‚Üí Backend clear ‚Üí UI animation ‚Üí Counter reset ‚Üí Fresh state |
| `#export-errors` | Export error logs to file | `connectButton` ‚Üí `window.electronAPI.exportLogs` | File dialog, save progress | ‚Üí Data collection ‚Üí File dialog ‚Üí Export processing ‚Üí Save confirmation ‚Üí Open location option |
| `#total-errors` | Total error counter | Updated by error events | Real-time count with color coding | ‚Üí Count animations ‚Üí Color thresholds ‚Üí Alert states ‚Üí Notification badges |
| `#chrome-errors` | Chrome-specific error count | Filtered error events | Chrome error subset count | ‚Üí Chrome error filtering ‚Üí Separate counter ‚Üí Status correlation ‚Üí Debug helpers |
| `#app-errors` | Application error count | Application error events | App-specific error count | ‚Üí App error filtering ‚Üí Source identification ‚Üí Stack trace links ‚Üí Fix suggestions |
| `.filter-btn[data-filter]` | Error type filters | `setErrorFilter(filter)` | Active state, filtered display | ‚Üí Filter application ‚Üí Count updates ‚Üí Color coding ‚Üí Export filtering ‚Üí Search enhancement |
| `#error-log` | Main error display area | Populated by error events | Empty state ‚Üí Scrolling error list with syntax highlighting | ‚Üí Error formatting ‚Üí Stack trace expansion ‚Üí Copy buttons ‚Üí Fix suggestions ‚Üí Source links |

#### **Terminal Tab Content**
| Element ID | Description | Function Chain | Expected UI State | Snowball Actions |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| `#new-terminal-btn` | Create new terminal instance | `connectButton` ‚Üí `window.electronAPI.createTerminal` | Button disabled, new terminal tab appears | ‚Üí Backend terminal spawn ‚Üí Tab creation ‚Üí Focus switch ‚Üí Connection establishment ‚Üí Ready state |
| `#split-terminal-btn` | Split current terminal | `connectButton` ‚Üí `window.electronAPI.splitTerminal` | Terminal splits horizontally/vertically | ‚Üí Layout calculation ‚Üí New pane creation ‚Üí Focus management ‚Üí Resize handles ‚Üí Independent scrolling |
| `#terminal-dropdown-btn` | Terminal options menu | `handleTerminalDropdown` | Dropdown menu appears with options | ‚Üí Menu positioning ‚Üí Option availability ‚Üí Keyboard shortcuts ‚Üí Context awareness |
| `#terminal-container` | Terminal display area | Managed by xterm.js | Empty ‚Üí Terminal instances with interactive shells | ‚Üí Shell initialization ‚Üí Color themes ‚Üí Resize handling ‚Üí Scroll management ‚Üí Command history |
| `#terminal-input` | Command input field | Direct command entry | Real-time validation, command suggestions | ‚Üí Command parsing ‚Üí Auto-completion ‚Üí History navigation ‚Üí Syntax highlighting ‚Üí Error prevention |
| `#terminal-send` | Send command button | Command execution trigger | Button states based on input validity | ‚Üí Command validation ‚Üí Execution ‚Üí Result streaming ‚Üí History update ‚Üí Error handling |
| `.dropdown-item[data-action]` | Terminal action items | `handleDropdownAction(action)` | Action-specific behavior | ‚Üí Action routing ‚Üí Confirmation dialogs ‚Üí State updates ‚Üí UI feedback ‚Üí Error handling |

#### **Dynamic Resizer System**
| Element ID | Description | Function Chain | Expected UI State | Snowball Actions |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| `#left-resizer` | Left panel resize handle | `attachHorizontalResizer()` | Cursor changes, drag feedback | ‚Üí Drag start ‚Üí Width calculations ‚Üí Live preview ‚Üí Snap boundaries ‚Üí State persistence |
| `#right-resizer` | Right panel resize handle | `attachHorizontalResizer()` | Cursor changes, drag feedback | ‚Üí Drag start ‚Üí Width calculations ‚Üí Live preview ‚Üí Snap boundaries ‚Üí State persistence |

### **FOOTER STATUS BAR** (`footer.status-footer`)
**Real-time system metrics and connection status**

#### **Live Metrics (Left Section)**
| Element ID | Description | Update Source | Expected Display | Snowball Actions |

## üîÑ **UNIVERSAL BEHAVIORAL PATTERNS**

### **State Management Chain:**
1. **User Interaction** ‚Üí UI feedback ‚Üí Loading state
2. **Function Execution** ‚Üí IPC communication ‚Üí Backend processing  
3. **Result Handling** ‚Üí UI updates ‚Üí State persistence
4. **Error Handling** ‚Üí User notification ‚Üí Recovery options
5. **Performance Tracking** ‚Üí Analytics ‚Üí Optimization triggers

### **Accessibility Chain:**
1. **Keyboard Navigation** ‚Üí Focus management ‚Üí Screen reader announcements
2. **Color Contrast** ‚Üí Theme compliance ‚Üí User preference respect
3. **Motion Preference** ‚Üí Animation controls ‚Üí Alternative displays
4. **Screen Reader** ‚Üí ARIA labels ‚Üí Semantic structure

### **Performance Chain:**
1. **Interaction Start** ‚Üí Immediate feedback ‚Üí Progress indication
2. **Processing** ‚Üí Background optimization ‚Üí Resource management
3. **Completion** ‚Üí Smooth transitions ‚Üí Memory cleanup
4. **Monitoring** ‚Üí Performance metrics ‚Üí Optimization triggers

### **Error Recovery Chain:**
1. **Error Detection** ‚Üí User notification ‚Üí Context preservation
2. **Recovery Options** ‚Üí Automatic retry ‚Üí Manual intervention
3. **State Restoration** ‚Üí Data recovery ‚Üí UI synchronization
4. **Prevention** ‚Üí Validation ‚Üí Guard clauses

## üìä **UNIVERSAL METRICS & MONITORING**

### **Performance Expectations:**
- **Button Response**: < 100ms visual feedback
- **IPC Calls**: < 500ms for standard operations
- **Modal Animations**: 200-300ms smooth transitions  
- **List Updates**: < 50ms for incremental updates
- **Search Results**: < 1000ms for complex queries

### **Error Boundaries:**
- **Network Errors**: Automatic retry with exponential backoff
- **IPC Failures**: Fallback to local state, user notification
- **UI Errors**: Component isolation, graceful degradation
- **Data Corruption**: Validation, backup restoration

### **User Experience Standards:**
- **Loading States**: Always visible for operations > 200ms
- **Error Messages**: Clear, actionable, non-technical
- **Success Feedback**: Immediate, contextually appropriate
- **Undo Capability**: Available for destructive operations
- **Data Persistence**: Automatic save, manual save options

**This document serves as the comprehensive behavioral contract for all Chrome Container App interfaces. Every interactive element must conform to these expectations, with proper error handling, performance optimization, and user experience standards.**

lines: This document defines the **complete behavioral contract** for every interactive DOM element across all interfaces within the Chrome Container App ecosystem. Each DOM element has dedicated tables showing expectations, snowball actions, and file dependencies.
-**All interactions across ALL interfaces MUST produce these trace events:**
-- `ui:click` for every clickable element with `ui:action-success | ui:action-error`
-- `ui:gesture:start | move | end` for all drag/resize operations with metrics
-- `ui:state-change` for visibility toggles, theme changes, tab switches

# COMPREHENSIVE DOM EXPECTATIONS & FUNCTION MAPPING
## Chrome Container App - Universal Interface Documentation

**GREP INSTRUCTION FOR AGENTS:** `grep -r "getElementById\|querySelector" apps/chrome-container/chrome-container-app/ --include="*.js" --include="*.html" | grep -E "(element-id-from-table)" | head -5` - Use this to trace all files that interact with any DOM element from the tables below.

This document defines the **complete behavioral contract** for every interactive DOM element across all interfaces within the Chrome Container App ecosystem. Each DOM element has dedicated tables showing expectations, snowball actions, and file dependencies.

## üìÅ **INTERFACE HIERARCHY**
- `renderer/index.html` ‚Üí Main Chrome Container Interface
- `public/index.html` ‚Üí Curatated Social Discovery Interface  
- `public/canvas.html` ‚Üí TLDraw Canvas Editor Interface
- `public/auth.html` ‚Üí Authentication Interface
- `public/profile.html` ‚Üí User Profile Interface
- `public/strike-errors.html` ‚Üí Strike Errors Analysis Interface

## üîÑ **UNIVERSAL TRACE CONTRACT**
All interactions MUST produce: `invoke:start|success|error`, `ui:click`, `ui:gesture:start|move|end`, `ui:state-change`, `renderer:init|ready|error`

## üéØ **INTERFACE 1: MAIN CHROME CONTAINER** (`renderer/index.html`)

### **HEADER SECTION** 
**Layout:** `header.header` containing brand, controls, and status indicators

| Element ID | Description | Function Chain | Expected UI State | Snowball Actions |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| `#header-toggle-left` | Toggle left sidebar visibility | `toggleToolbar('leftToolbar')` | Sidebar slides in/out, arrow rotates, main content adjusts width | ‚Üí Updates layout classes ‚Üí Triggers resize events ‚Üí Saves state to localStorage |
| `#header-toggle-right` | Toggle right sidebar visibility | `toggleToolbar('rightToolbar')` | Sidebar slides in/out, arrow rotates, terminal content reflows | ‚Üí Updates layout classes ‚Üí Triggers resize events ‚Üí Saves state to localStorage |
| `#header-reset-layout` | Reset all panel sizes to default | `resetLayoutSizing()` | All panels return to default widths, clears custom sizing | ‚Üí Removes inline styles ‚Üí Resets CSS variables ‚Üí Triggers layout recalc |
| `#header-screenshot-btn` | Global screenshot capture | `connectButton` ‚Üí `window.electronAPI.takeScreenshot` | Button disables 500ms, loading state, success notification | ‚Üí IPC call ‚Üí File save ‚Üí UI notification ‚Üí Counter update ‚Üí Gallery refresh |

**Status Indicators (Read-only but state-reactive):**
- `#chrome-status`: Chrome connection state with color-coded icons
- `#connection-status`: Active connection count with live updates  
- `.status-icon`: Visual state indicators that change color/symbol based on backend status

### **LEFT TOOLBAR** (`aside.left-toolbar`)
**Sections:** Strike Errors + AI File Browser + Mermaid Diagrams

#### **Strike Errors Section**
| Element ID | Description | Function Chain | Expected UI State | Snowball Actions |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| `#launch-strike-errors` | Launch AI code analysis | `connectButton` ‚Üí `window.electronAPI.strikeErrorsOpen` | Button disabled, progress bar appears, status dot changes to analyzing | ‚Üí Opens Strike Errors window ‚Üí Initializes analysis ‚Üí Updates progress UI ‚Üí Streams results |
| `#upload-files` | Directory selection for analysis | `connectButton` ‚Üí `window.electronAPI.openDirectory` | File dialog opens, loading state on selection | ‚Üí File browser ‚Üí Directory scan ‚Üí File tree population ‚Üí AI path analysis ‚Üí Confidence scoring |
| `#strikeStatusDot` | Visual status indicator | Updates via backend events | Color changes: gray(ready) ‚Üí orange(analyzing) ‚Üí green(complete) ‚Üí red(error) | ‚Üí Status text updates ‚Üí Progress visibility ‚Üí Health scores appear |
| `#strikeProgress` | Analysis progress display | Controlled by analysis events | Hidden ‚Üí Visible with animated progress bar ‚Üí Auto-hide on completion | ‚Üí Progress fill animation ‚Üí Percentage text ‚Üí ETA calculations |
| `#healthScores` | Analysis results grid | Populated by analysis completion | Hidden ‚Üí Slides in with score animations ‚Üí Color-coded results | ‚Üí Score animations ‚Üí Hover tooltips ‚Üí Detailed breakdown modal trigger |

#### **AI File Browser Section**
| Element ID | Description | Function Chain | Expected UI State | Snowball Actions |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| `#uploadStatus` | File upload progress display | Updates during directory scanning | Shows file count, confidence percentage | ‚Üí Real-time counter updates ‚Üí Confidence badge color changes ‚Üí Progress indication |
| `#directoryTree` | Hierarchical file structure | Populated by AI analysis | Empty state ‚Üí Loading ‚Üí Tree structure with icons | ‚Üí Expandable nodes ‚Üí File previews ‚Üí AI suggestions ‚Üí Path intelligence |
| `#pathSuggestions` | AI-powered path recommendations | Generated by analysis completion | Hidden ‚Üí Slides in with suggested paths and confidence scores | ‚Üí Clickable suggestions ‚Üí Path validation ‚Üí Auto-completion ‚Üí Integration recommendations |

#### **Mermaid Diagram Section**
| Element ID | Description | Function Chain | Expected UI State | Snowball Actions |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| `#diagramType` | Diagram type selector | Dropdown selection updates internal state | Updates selected option, enables generate button | ‚Üí Validates data compatibility ‚Üí Updates example preview ‚Üí Enables/disables options |
| `#generateDiagram` | Create diagram from analysis | `connectButton` ‚Üí `handleGenerateDiagram` | Loading state, then diagram renders or shows error | ‚Üí Data processing ‚Üí Mermaid rendering ‚Üí Interactive diagram ‚Üí Export options ‚Üí Zoom/pan controls |
| `#diagramContainer` | Rendered diagram display area | Populated by generation process | Empty state ‚Üí Loading ‚Üí Interactive diagram with controls | ‚Üí Zoom controls ‚Üí Export buttons ‚Üí Fullscreen mode ‚Üí Edit mode trigger |

### **CENTRAL CHROME VIEWPORT** (`section.chrome-viewport`)
**Purpose:** Universal interface container with embedded webview

| Element ID | Description | Function Chain | Expected UI State | Snowball Actions |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| `#initialize-chrome` | Start Chrome connection | `connectButton` ‚Üí `window.electronAPI.initializeChrome` | Button disabled, status changes to "Connecting" | ‚Üí Chrome process spawn ‚Üí Debug port connection ‚Üí Status updates ‚Üí Webview activation |
| `#restart-chrome` | Restart Chrome instance | `connectButton` ‚Üí `window.electronAPI.restartChrome` | Button disabled, status changes to "Restarting" | ‚Üí Process kill ‚Üí Cleanup ‚Üí Respawn ‚Üí Reconnection ‚Üí State restoration |
| `#navigate-canvas` | Navigate to canvas interface | `connectButton` ‚Üí `window.electronAPI.navigateCanvas` | Button disabled, webview shows loading | ‚Üí URL navigation ‚Üí Canvas interface load ‚Üí Tool initialization ‚Üí State sync |
| `#refresh-webview` | Reload webview content | `connectButton` ‚Üí `document.getElementById('chrome-viewport')?.reload()` | Webview reloads, temporary loading state | ‚Üí Content refresh ‚Üí State reset ‚Üí Event re-binding ‚Üí UI reinitialization |
| `#chrome-viewport` | Main content webview | Controlled by Chrome connection | Loading ‚Üí Connected ‚Üí Interactive content | ‚Üí Page loads ‚Üí Tools activate ‚Üí Events bridge ‚Üí Screenshots possible |

### **RIGHT TOOLBAR** (`aside.right-toolbar`)
**Sections:** Tab-based interface with Planning, Messages, Errors, Terminal

#### **Tab Navigation System**
| Element Class | Description | Function Chain | Expected UI State | Snowball Actions |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| `.tab-btn[data-tab="planning"]` | Switch to planning tab | `switchTab('planning')` | Active state, planning content visible | ‚Üí Hides other tabs ‚Üí Shows planning section ‚Üí Updates breadcrumb ‚Üí Loads recent files |
| `.tab-btn[data-tab="messages"]` | Switch to messages tab | `switchTab('messages')` | Active state, message interface visible | ‚Üí Shows message compose ‚Üí Loads queued messages ‚Üí Enables send controls |
| `.tab-btn[data-tab="errors"]` | Switch to error logs tab | `switchTab('errors')` | Active state, error monitoring visible | ‚Üí Shows error filters ‚Üí Loads recent errors ‚Üí Activates real-time updates |
| `.tab-btn[data-tab="terminal"]` | Switch to terminal tab | `switchTab('terminal')` | Active state, terminal interface visible | ‚Üí Activates terminal ‚Üí Shows command input ‚Üí Connects to backend |

#### **Planning Tab Content**
| Element ID | Description | Function Chain | Expected UI State | Snowball Actions |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| `#import-md` | Import markdown files | `connectButton` ‚Üí `window.electronAPI.importMdFile` | File dialog opens, processing on selection | ‚Üí File dialog ‚Üí Content parsing ‚Üí Preview generation ‚Üí File list update ‚Üí Guidance display |
| `#take-screenshot` | Capture current view | `connectButton` ‚Üí `window.electronAPI.takeScreenshot` | Button disabled, capture animation | ‚Üí Screen capture ‚Üí File save ‚Üí Thumbnail generation ‚Üí Gallery append ‚Üí Counter update |

2. **Function Execution** ‚Üí IPC communication ‚Üí Backend processing  
3. **Result Handling** ‚Üí UI updates ‚Üí State persistence
4. **Error Handling** ‚Üí User notification ‚Üí Recovery options
5. **Performance Tracking** ‚Üí Analytics ‚Üí Optimization triggers

### **Performance Chain:**

2. **Processing** ‚Üí Background optimization ‚Üí Resource management
3. **Completion** ‚Üí Smooth transitions ‚Üí Memory cleanup
4. **Monitoring** ‚Üí Performance metrics ‚Üí Optimization triggers

### **Error Recovery Chain:**
1. **Error Detection** ‚Üí User notification ‚Üí Context preservation
2. **Recovery Options** ‚Üí Automatic retry ‚Üí Manual intervention
3. **State Restoration** ‚Üí Data recovery ‚Üí UI synchronization
4. **Prevention** ‚Üí Validation ‚Üí Guard clauses

## üìä **UNIVERSAL METRICS & MONITORING**

### **Performance Expectations:**
- **Button Response**: < 100ms visual feedback
- **IPC Calls**: < 500ms for standard operations
- **Modal Animations**: 200-300ms smooth transitions  
- **List Updates**: < 50ms for incremental updates
- **Search Results**: < 1000ms for complex queries

### **Error Boundaries:**
- **Network Errors**: Automatic retry with exponential backoff
- **IPC Failures**: Fallback to local state, user notification
- **UI Errors**: Component isolation, graceful degradation
- **Data Corruption**: Validation, backup restoration

### **User Experience Standards:**
- **Loading States**: Always visible for operations > 200ms
- **Error Messages**: Clear, actionable, non-technical
- **Success Feedback**: Immediate, contextually appropriate
- **Undo Capability**: Available for destructive operations
- **Data Persistence**: Automatic save, manual save options

# COMPREHENSIVE DOM EXPECTATIONS & FUNCTION MAPPING
## Chrome Container App - Universal Interface Documentation

**GREP INSTRUCTION FOR AGENTS:** `grep -r "getElementById\|querySelector" apps/chrome-container/chrome-container-app/ --include="*.js" --include="*.html" | grep -E "(element-id-from-table)" | head -5` - Use this to trace all files that interact with any DOM element from the tables below.

This document defines the **complete behavioral contract** for every interactive DOM element across all interfaces within the Chrome Container App ecosystem. Each DOM element has dedicated tables showing expectations, snowball actions, and file dependencies.

## üìÅ **INTERFACE HIERARCHY**
- `renderer/index.html` ‚Üí Main Chrome Container Interface
- `public/index.html` ‚Üí Curatated Social Discovery Interface  
- `public/canvas.html` ‚Üí TLDraw Canvas Editor Interface
- `public/auth.html` ‚Üí Authentication Interface
- `public/profile.html` ‚Üí User Profile Interface
- `public/strike-errors.html` ‚Üí Strike Errors Analysis Interface

## üîÑ **UNIVERSAL TRACE CONTRACT**
All interactions MUST produce: `invoke:start|success|error`, `ui:click`, `ui:gesture:start|move|end`, `ui:state-change`, `renderer:init|ready|error`

---

# üéØ MAIN CHROME CONTAINER INTERFACE (`renderer/index.html`)

## üìä **UNIVERSAL METRICS & MONITORING**

### **Performance Expectations:**
- **Button Response**: < 100ms visual feedback
- **IPC Calls**: < 500ms for standard operations
- **Modal Animations**: 200-300ms smooth transitions  
- **List Updates**: < 50ms for incremental updates
- **Search Results**: < 1000ms for complex queries

### **Error Boundaries:**
- **Network Errors**: Automatic retry with exponential backoff
- **IPC Failures**: Fallback to local state, user notification
- **UI Errors**: Component isolation, graceful degradation
- **Data Corruption**: Validation, backup restoration

### **User Experience Standards:**
- **Loading States**: Always visible for operations > 200ms
- **Error Messages**: Clear, actionable, non-technical
- **Success Feedback**: Immediate, contextually appropriate
- **Undo Capability**: Available for destructive operations
- **Data Persistence**: Automatic save, manual save options

---

**This document serves as the comprehensive behavioral contract for all Chrome Container App interfaces. Every interactive element must conform to these expectations, with proper error handling, performance optimization, and user experience standards.**

# COMPREHENSIVE DOM EXPECTATIONS & FUNCTION MAPPING
## Chrome Container App - Universal Interface Documentation

**GREP INSTRUCTION FOR AGENTS:** `grep -r "getElementById\|querySelector" apps/chrome-container/chrome-container-app/ --include="*.js" --include="*.html" | grep -E "(element-id-from-table)" | head -5` - Use this to trace all files that interact with any DOM element from the tables below.

This document defines the **complete behavioral contract** for every interactive DOM element across all interfaces within the Chrome Container App ecosystem. Each DOM element has dedicated tables showing expectations, snowball actions, and file dependencies.

## üìÅ **INTERFACE HIERARCHY**
- `renderer/index.html` ‚Üí Main Chrome Container Interface
- `public/index.html` ‚Üí Curatated Social Discovery Interface  
- `public/canvas.html` ‚Üí TLDraw Canvas Editor Interface
- `public/auth.html` ‚Üí Authentication Interface
- `public/profile.html` ‚Üí User Profile Interface
- `public/strike-errors.html` ‚Üí Strike Errors Analysis Interface

## üîÑ **UNIVERSAL TRACE CONTRACT**
All interactions MUST produce: `invoke:start|success|error`, `ui:click`, `ui:gesture:start|move|end`, `ui:state-change`, `renderer:init|ready|error`

---

# üéØ MAIN CHROME CONTAINER INTERFACE (`renderer/index.html`)

| **Files Involved** | `renderer/app.js:86`, `renderer/index.html:89` |

### **Expectations & State**
| **Trigger** | **Expected UI State** | **Performance** |
|---|---|---|
| Click | Sidebar slides in/out, arrow rotates ‚óÄ/‚ñ∂ | < 100ms response |
| During Animation | Main content width adjusts smoothly | 200-300ms transition |
| Completed | Layout classes updated, state persisted | localStorage saved |

### **Snowball Action Chain**
| **Step** | **Action** | **File:Line** | **Expected Outcome** |

| 1 | Update toolbar classes | `app.js:493` | `.collapsed` toggle |
| 2 | Rotate arrow icon | `app.js:496` | ‚óÄ ‚Üî ‚ñ∂ direction change |
| 3 | Trigger resize events | `app.js:500` | Layout recalculation |
| 4 | Save state to localStorage | `app.js:501` | Persistence across sessions |

## üìä **UNIVERSAL METRICS & MONITORING**

### **Performance Expectations:**
- **Button Response**: < 100ms visual feedback
- **IPC Calls**: < 500ms for standard operations
- **Modal Animations**: 200-300ms smooth transitions  
- **List Updates**: < 50ms for incremental updates
- **Search Results**: < 1000ms for complex queries

### **Error Boundaries:**
- **Network Errors**: Automatic retry with exponential backoff
- **IPC Failures**: Fallback to local state, user notification
- **UI Errors**: Component isolation, graceful degradation
- **Data Corruption**: Validation, backup restoration

### **User Experience Standards:**
- **Loading States**: Always visible for operations > 200ms
- **Error Messages**: Clear, actionable, non-technical
- **Success Feedback**: Immediate, contextually appropriate
- **Undo Capability**: Available for destructive operations
- **Data Persistence**: Automatic save, manual save options

---

**This document serves as the comprehensive behavioral contract for all Chrome Container App interfaces. Every interactive element must conform to these expectations, with proper error handling, performance optimization, and user experience standards.**

input.old_string:
### **CENTRAL CHROME VIEWPORT** (`section.chrome-viewport`)
**Purpose:** Universal interface container with embedded webview

| Element ID | Description | Function Chain | Expected UI State | Snowball Actions |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| `#initialize-chrome` | Start Chrome connection | `connectButton` ‚Üí `window.electronAPI.initializeChrome` | Button disabled, status changes to "Connecting" | ‚Üí Chrome process spawn ‚Üí Debug port connection ‚Üí Status updates ‚Üí Webview activation |
| `#restart-chrome` | Restart Chrome instance | `connectButton` ‚Üí `window.electronAPI.restartChrome` | Button disabled, status changes to "Restarting" | ‚Üí Process kill ‚Üí Cleanup ‚Üí Respawn ‚Üí Reconnection ‚Üí State restoration |
| `#navigate-canvas` | Navigate to canvas interface | `connectButton` ‚Üí `window.electronAPI.navigateCanvas` | Button disabled, webview shows loading | ‚Üí URL navigation ‚Üí Canvas interface load ‚Üí Tool initialization ‚Üí State sync |
| `#refresh-webview` | Reload webview content | `connectButton` ‚Üí `document.getElementById('chrome-viewport')?.reload()` | Webview reloads, temporary loading state | ‚Üí Content refresh ‚Üí State reset ‚Üí Event re-binding ‚Üí UI reinitialization |
| `#chrome-viewport` | Main content webview | Controlled by Chrome connection | Loading ‚Üí Connected ‚Üí Interactive content | ‚Üí Page loads ‚Üí Tools activate ‚Üí Events bridge ‚Üí Screenshots possible |

## DOM Element: `#initialize-chrome`

| **Property** | **Value** |
|---|---|
| **Description** | Start Chrome connection |
| **Location** | `renderer/index.html` (central viewport section) |
| **Function Chain** | `connectButton` ‚Üí `window.electronAPI.initializeChrome` |
| **Files Involved** | `renderer/app.js:41`, `renderer/index.html` |

### **Expectations & State**
| **Trigger** | **Expected UI State** | **Performance** |
|---|---|---|
| Click | Button disabled, status "Connecting" | < 100ms response |
| Connecting | Chrome process spawning | < 3s startup |
| Connected | Webview activates, debug port ready | Live polling updates |

| **Step** | **Action** | **File:Line** | **Expected Outcome** |

| 5 | Status updates | Live polling | UI reflects connection |
| 6 | Webview activation | Browser | Interactive Chrome content |

# COMPREHENSIVE DOM EXPECTATIONS & FUNCTION MAPPING
## Chrome Container App - Universal Interface Documentation

**GREP INSTRUCTION FOR AGENTS:** `grep -r "getElementById\|querySelector" apps/chrome-container/chrome-container-app/ --include="*.js" --include="*.html" | grep -E "(element-id-from-table)" | head -5` - Use this to trace all files that interact with any DOM element from the tables below.

This document defines the **complete behavioral contract** for every interactive DOM element across all interfaces within the Chrome Container App ecosystem. Each DOM element has dedicated tables showing expectations, snowball actions, and file dependencies.

## üìÅ **INTERFACE HIERARCHY**
- `renderer/index.html` ‚Üí Main Chrome Container Interface
- `public/index.html` ‚Üí Curatated Social Discovery Interface  
- `public/canvas.html` ‚Üí TLDraw Canvas Editor Interface
- `public/auth.html` ‚Üí Authentication Interface
- `public/profile.html` ‚Üí User Profile Interface
- `public/strike-errors.html` ‚Üí Strike Errors Analysis Interface

## üîÑ **UNIVERSAL TRACE CONTRACT**
All interactions MUST produce: `invoke:start|success|error`, `ui:click`, `ui:gesture:start|move|end`, `ui:state-change`, `renderer:init|ready|error`

---

# üéØ MAIN CHROME CONTAINER INTERFACE (`renderer/index.html`)

| **Description** | Toggle left sidebar visibility |

| **Function Chain** | `addEventListener('click')` ‚Üí `toggleToolbar('leftToolbar')` |
| **Files Involved** | `renderer/app.js:86`, `renderer/index.html:89` |

### **Expectations & State**
| **Trigger** | **Expected UI State** | **Performance** |
|---|---|---|
| Click | Sidebar slides in/out, arrow rotates ‚óÄ/‚ñ∂ | < 100ms response |
| During Animation | Main content width adjusts smoothly | 200-300ms transition |
| Completed | Layout classes updated, state persisted | localStorage saved |

### **Snowball Action Chain**

| 1 | Update toolbar classes | `app.js:493` | `.collapsed` toggle |
| 2 | Rotate arrow icon | `app.js:496` | ‚óÄ ‚Üî ‚ñ∂ direction change |
| 3 | Trigger resize events | `app.js:500` | Layout recalculation |
| 4 | Save state to localStorage | `app.js:501` | Persistence across sessions |

## ‚ö° **INTERFACE 6: STRIKE ERRORS ANALYSIS** (`public/strike-errors.html`)

### **Analysis Interface**
| Element Class | Description | Function Chain | Expected UI State | Snowball Actions |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| Analysis controls | Code analysis management | Analysis workflow | Progress states, result display | ‚Üí File scanning ‚Üí Error detection ‚Üí Report generation ‚Üí Export options |
| Error visualization | Error display and navigation | Interactive error exploration | Filterable lists, detail views | ‚Üí Error categorization ‚Üí Source navigation ‚Üí Fix suggestions ‚Üí Priority ranking |

## üîÑ **UNIVERSAL BEHAVIORAL PATTERNS**

### **State Management Chain:**
1. **User Interaction** ‚Üí UI feedback ‚Üí Loading state
2. **Function Execution** ‚Üí IPC communication ‚Üí Backend processing  
3. **Result Handling** ‚Üí UI updates ‚Üí State persistence
4. **Error Handling** ‚Üí User notification ‚Üí Recovery options
5. **Performance Tracking** ‚Üí Analytics ‚Üí Optimization triggers

### **Accessibility Chain:**
1. **Keyboard Navigation** ‚Üí Focus management ‚Üí Screen reader announcements
2. **Color Contrast** ‚Üí Theme compliance ‚Üí User preference respect
3. **Motion Preference** ‚Üí Animation controls ‚Üí Alternative displays
4. **Screen Reader** ‚Üí ARIA labels ‚Üí Semantic structure

### **Performance Chain:**
1. **Interaction Start** ‚Üí Immediate feedback ‚Üí Progress indication
2. **Processing** ‚Üí Background optimization ‚Üí Resource management
3. **Completion** ‚Üí Smooth transitions ‚Üí Memory cleanup
4. **Monitoring** ‚Üí Performance metrics ‚Üí Optimization triggers

### **Error Recovery Chain:**
1. **Error Detection** ‚Üí User notification ‚Üí Context preservation
2. **Recovery Options** ‚Üí Automatic retry ‚Üí Manual intervention
3. **State Restoration** ‚Üí Data recovery ‚Üí UI synchronization
4. **Prevention** ‚Üí Validation ‚Üí Guard clauses

## üìä **UNIVERSAL METRICS & MONITORING**

### **Performance Expectations:**
- **Button Response**: < 100ms visual feedback
- **IPC Calls**: < 500ms for standard operations
- **Modal Animations**: 200-300ms smooth transitions  
- **List Updates**: < 50ms for incremental updates
- **Search Results**: < 1000ms for complex queries

### **Error Boundaries:**
- **Network Errors**: Automatic retry with exponential backoff
- **IPC Failures**: Fallback to local state, user notification
- **UI Errors**: Component isolation, graceful degradation
- **Data Corruption**: Validation, backup restoration

### **User Experience Standards:**
- **Loading States**: Always visible for operations > 200ms
- **Error Messages**: Clear, actionable, non-technical
- **Success Feedback**: Immediate, contextually appropriate
- **Undo Capability**: Available for destructive operations
- **Data Persistence**: Automatic save, manual save options

# COMPREHENSIVE DOM EXPECTATIONS & FUNCTION MAPPING
## Chrome Container App - Universal Interface Documentation

**GREP INSTRUCTION FOR AGENTS:** `grep -r "getElementById\|querySelector" apps/chrome-container/chrome-container-app/ --include="*.js" --include="*.html" | grep -E "(element-id-from-table)" | head -5` - Use this to trace all files that interact with any DOM element from the tables below.

This document defines the **complete behavioral contract** for every interactive DOM element across all interfaces within the Chrome Container App ecosystem. Each DOM element has dedicated tables showing expectations, snowball actions, and file dependencies.

## üìÅ **INTERFACE HIERARCHY**
- `renderer/index.html` ‚Üí Main Chrome Container Interface
- `public/index.html` ‚Üí Curatated Social Discovery Interface  
- `public/canvas.html` ‚Üí TLDraw Canvas Editor Interface
- `public/auth.html` ‚Üí Authentication Interface
- `public/profile.html` ‚Üí User Profile Interface
- `public/strike-errors.html` ‚Üí Strike Errors Analysis Interface

## üîÑ **UNIVERSAL TRACE CONTRACT**
All interactions MUST produce: `invoke:start|success|error`, `ui:click`, `ui:gesture:start|move|end`, `ui:state-change`, `renderer:init|ready|error`

## üìä **UNIVERSAL METRICS & MONITORING**

### **Performance Expectations:**
- **Button Response**: < 100ms visual feedback
- **IPC Calls**: < 500ms for standard operations
- **Modal Animations**: 200-300ms smooth transitions  
- **List Updates**: < 50ms for incremental updates
- **Search Results**: < 1000ms for complex queries

### **Error Boundaries:**
- **Network Errors**: Automatic retry with exponential backoff
- **IPC Failures**: Fallback to local state, user notification
- **UI Errors**: Component isolation, graceful degradation
- **Data Corruption**: Validation, backup restoration

### **User Experience Standards:**
- **Loading States**: Always visible for operations > 200ms
- **Error Messages**: Clear, actionable, non-technical
- **Success Feedback**: Immediate, contextually appropriate
- **Undo Capability**: Available for destructive operations
- **Data Persistence**: Automatic save, manual save options

---

**This document serves as the comprehensive behavioral contract for all Chrome Container App interfaces. Every interactive element must conform to these expectations, with proper error handling, performance optimization, and user experience standards.**

## **Agent Usage Instructions:**
1. **Find Element:** Use grep instruction at top of document
2. **Trace Expectations:** Check "Expectations & State" table
3. **Follow Snowball Chain:** Use "Snowball Action Chain" for complete flow
4. **Identify Files:** "Files Involved" shows all modification targets
5. **Performance Targets:** Built-in performance expectations for each interaction

#### **Tab Navigation System**
| Element Class | Description | Function Chain | Expected UI State | Snowball Actions |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| `.tab-btn[data-tab="planning"]` | Switch to planning tab | `switchTab('planning')` | Active state, planning content visible | ‚Üí Hides other tabs ‚Üí Shows planning section ‚Üí Updates breadcrumb ‚Üí Loads recent files |
| `.tab-btn[data-tab="messages"]` | Switch to messages tab | `switchTab('messages')` | Active state, message interface visible | ‚Üí Shows message compose ‚Üí Loads queued messages ‚Üí Enables send controls |
| `.tab-btn[data-tab="errors"]` | Switch to error logs tab | `switchTab('errors')` | Active state, error monitoring visible | ‚Üí Shows error filters ‚Üí Loads recent errors ‚Üí Activates real-time updates |
| `.tab-btn[data-tab="terminal"]` | Switch to terminal tab | `switchTab('terminal')` | Active state, terminal interface visible | ‚Üí Activates terminal ‚Üí Shows command input ‚Üí Connects to backend |

#### **Planning Tab Content**
| Element ID | Description | Function Chain | Expected UI State | Snowball Actions |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| `#import-md` | Import markdown files | `connectButton` ‚Üí `window.electronAPI.importMdFile` | File dialog opens, processing on selection | ‚Üí File dialog ‚Üí Content parsing ‚Üí Preview generation ‚Üí File list update ‚Üí Guidance display |
| `#take-screenshot` | Capture current view | `connectButton` ‚Üí `window.electronAPI.takeScreenshot` | Button disabled, capture animation | ‚Üí Screen capture ‚Üí File save ‚Üí Thumbnail generation ‚Üí Gallery append ‚Üí Counter update |
| `#clear-screenshots` | Remove all screenshots | `connectButton` ‚Üí `window.electronAPI.clearScreenshots` | Confirmation dialog, then cleanup | ‚Üí Confirmation ‚Üí File deletion ‚Üí Gallery clear ‚Üí Counter reset ‚Üí Placeholder restore |
| `#imported-files` | File list container | Populated by import actions | Empty ‚Üí File items with status indicators | ‚Üí File icons ‚Üí Preview buttons ‚Üí Status badges ‚Üí Action menus |
| `#guidance-content` | Markdown preview area | Updated by file imports | Empty ‚Üí Formatted markdown content | ‚Üí Syntax highlighting ‚Üí Link parsing ‚Üí Image embedding ‚Üí Scroll to sections |
| `#screenshots-list` | Screenshot gallery | Updated by capture events | Empty state ‚Üí Thumbnail grid with hover controls | ‚Üí Thumbnail generation ‚Üí Hover preview ‚Üí Delete buttons ‚Üí Fullscreen view ‚Üí Export options |
| `#screenshot-count` | Image counter display | Updates with screenshot events | Shows current count with grammar-aware pluralization | ‚Üí Count animation ‚Üí Color changes based on quantity ‚Üí Storage warning states |

#### **Messages Tab Content**
| Element ID | Description | Function Chain | Expected UI State | Snowball Actions |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| `#message-type` | Message priority selector | Updates compose context | Changes placeholder text and button styles | ‚Üí Updates send button appearance ‚Üí Changes validation rules ‚Üí Affects routing priority |
| `#message-content` | Message composition area | Real-time input validation | Auto-resize, character count, validation feedback | ‚Üí Character counting ‚Üí Auto-save drafts ‚Üí Validation highlighting ‚Üí Send button state |
| `#send-message` | Send message to backend | `connectButton` ‚Üí `handleSendMessage` | Button disabled, message queued | ‚Üí IPC message ‚Üí Backend routing ‚Üí Confirmation ‚Üí Clear input ‚Üí Success notification |
| `#queue-message` | Add to local message queue | `connectButton` ‚Üí `handleQueueMessage` | Message added to visual queue | ‚Üí Local storage ‚Üí Queue display update ‚Üí Clear input ‚Üí Batch send option |
| `#urgent-message` | Send high-priority message | `connectButton` ‚Üí `handleUrgentMessage` | Special styling, immediate send | ‚Üí Priority routing ‚Üí Immediate IPC ‚Üí Alert styling ‚Üí Clear input ‚Üí Acknowledgment required |
| `#queued-messages` | Local message queue display | Updated by queue actions | Empty ‚Üí Message list with timestamps and priority indicators | ‚Üí Message bubbles ‚Üí Timestamp formatting ‚Üí Priority badges ‚Üí Batch actions ‚Üí Individual delete |

#### **Error Logs Tab Content**
| Element ID | Description | Function Chain | Expected UI State | Snowball Actions |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| `#clear-errors` | Clear all error logs | `connectButton` ‚Üí `window.electronAPI.clearErrors` | Confirmation, then clear animation | ‚Üí Confirmation dialog ‚Üí Backend clear ‚Üí UI animation ‚Üí Counter reset ‚Üí Fresh state |
| `#export-errors` | Export error logs to file | `connectButton` ‚Üí `window.electronAPI.exportLogs` | File dialog, save progress | ‚Üí Data collection ‚Üí File dialog ‚Üí Export processing ‚Üí Save confirmation ‚Üí Open location option |
| `#total-errors` | Total error counter | Updated by error events | Real-time count with color coding | ‚Üí Count animations ‚Üí Color thresholds ‚Üí Alert states ‚Üí Notification badges |
| `#chrome-errors` | Chrome-specific error count | Filtered error events | Chrome error subset count | ‚Üí Chrome error filtering ‚Üí Separate counter ‚Üí Status correlation ‚Üí Debug helpers |
| `#app-errors` | Application error count | Application error events | App-specific error count | ‚Üí App error filtering ‚Üí Source identification ‚Üí Stack trace links ‚Üí Fix suggestions |
| `.filter-btn[data-filter]` | Error type filters | `setErrorFilter(filter)` | Active state, filtered display | ‚Üí Filter application ‚Üí Count updates ‚Üí Color coding ‚Üí Export filtering ‚Üí Search enhancement |
| `#error-log` | Main error display area | Populated by error events | Empty state ‚Üí Scrolling error list with syntax highlighting | ‚Üí Error formatting ‚Üí Stack trace expansion ‚Üí Copy buttons ‚Üí Fix suggestions ‚Üí Source links |

#### **Terminal Tab Content**
| Element ID | Description | Function Chain | Expected UI State | Snowball Actions |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| `#new-terminal-btn` | Create new terminal instance | `connectButton` ‚Üí `window.electronAPI.createTerminal` | Button disabled, new terminal tab appears | ‚Üí Backend terminal spawn ‚Üí Tab creation ‚Üí Focus switch ‚Üí Connection establishment ‚Üí Ready state |
| `#split-terminal-btn` | Split current terminal | `connectButton` ‚Üí `window.electronAPI.splitTerminal` | Terminal splits horizontally/vertically | ‚Üí Layout calculation ‚Üí New pane creation ‚Üí Focus management ‚Üí Resize handles ‚Üí Independent scrolling |
| `#terminal-dropdown-btn` | Terminal options menu | `handleTerminalDropdown` | Dropdown menu appears with options | ‚Üí Menu positioning ‚Üí Option availability ‚Üí Keyboard shortcuts ‚Üí Context awareness |
| `#terminal-container` | Terminal display area | Managed by xterm.js | Empty ‚Üí Terminal instances with interactive shells | ‚Üí Shell initialization ‚Üí Color themes ‚Üí Resize handling ‚Üí Scroll management ‚Üí Command history |
| `#terminal-input` | Command input field | Direct command entry | Real-time validation, command suggestions | ‚Üí Command parsing ‚Üí Auto-completion ‚Üí History navigation ‚Üí Syntax highlighting ‚Üí Error prevention |
| `#terminal-send` | Send command button | Command execution trigger | Button states based on input validity | ‚Üí Command validation ‚Üí Execution ‚Üí Result streaming ‚Üí History update ‚Üí Error handling |
| `.dropdown-item[data-action]` | Terminal action items | `handleDropdownAction(action)` | Action-specific behavior | ‚Üí Action routing ‚Üí Confirmation dialogs ‚Üí State updates ‚Üí UI feedback ‚Üí Error handling |

#### **Dynamic Resizer System**
| Element ID | Description | Function Chain | Expected UI State | Snowball Actions |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| `#left-resizer` | Left panel resize handle | `attachHorizontalResizer()` | Cursor changes, drag feedback | ‚Üí Drag start ‚Üí Width calculations ‚Üí Live preview ‚Üí Snap boundaries ‚Üí State persistence |
| `#right-resizer` | Right panel resize handle | `attachHorizontalResizer()` | Cursor changes, drag feedback | ‚Üí Drag start ‚Üí Width calculations ‚Üí Live preview ‚Üí Snap boundaries ‚Üí State persistence |

### **FOOTER STATUS BAR** (`footer.status-footer`)
**Real-time system metrics and connection status**

#### **Live Metrics (Left Section)**
| Element ID | Description | Update Source | Expected Display | Snowball Actions |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| `#footer-cpu-usage` | CPU utilization percentage | System monitoring events | Real-time percentage with color coding | ‚Üí Threshold alerts ‚Üí Performance warnings ‚Üí Graph mini-preview ‚Üí History tracking |
| `#footer-cpu-bar` | CPU usage progress bar | CPU monitoring events | Animated progress bar with color thresholds | ‚Üí Animation smoothing ‚Üí Color transitions ‚Üí Warning states ‚Üí Click for details |
| `#footer-memory-usage` | Memory usage display | Memory monitoring events | MB/GB with intelligent formatting | ‚Üí Unit conversion ‚Üí Trend indicators ‚Üí Memory warnings ‚Üí Garbage collection hints |
| `#footer-memory-bar` | Memory usage progress bar | Memory monitoring events | Visual memory pressure indicator | ‚Üí Color coding ‚Üí Animation ‚Üí Threshold warnings ‚Üí Optimization suggestions |
| `#footer-chrome-tabs` | Active Chrome tab count | Chrome connection events | Real-time tab count | ‚Üí Tab tracking ‚Üí Memory correlation ‚Üí Performance impact ‚Üí Tab management hints |

#### **AI Status (Center Section)**
| Element ID | Description | Update Source | Expected Display | Snowball Actions |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| `#footer-ai-status-icon` | AI connection status dot | AI service events | Color-coded status indicator | ‚Üí Status color changes ‚Üí Animation states ‚Üí Error indicators ‚Üí Reconnection triggers |
| `#footer-ai-status-text` | AI status description | AI service events | Human-readable status text | ‚Üí Status messages ‚Üí Error descriptions ‚Üí Performance indicators ‚Üí Action suggestions |
| `#footer-strike-status-icon` | Strike Errors status dot | Strike service events | Analysis status indicator | ‚Üí Analysis states ‚Üí Progress indication ‚Üí Error states ‚Üí Completion signals |
| `#footer-strike-status-text` | Strike status description | Strike service events | Current analysis state | ‚Üí Progress messages ‚Üí Result summaries ‚Üí Error notifications ‚Üí Next action hints |

#### **Connection Status (Right Section)**
| Element ID | Description | Update Source | Expected Display | Snowball Actions |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| `#footer-connections` | Active connection count | Connection monitoring | Real-time connection count | ‚Üí Connection tracking ‚Üí Performance correlation ‚Üí Capacity warnings ‚Üí Load balancing hints |
| `#footer-websocket-status` | WebSocket connection status | WebSocket events | Port and status display | ‚Üí Connection health ‚Üí Reconnection attempts ‚Üí Error states ‚Üí Debug information |
| `#footer-cdp-status` | Chrome DevTools Protocol status | CDP events | Port and connection state | ‚Üí Protocol health ‚Üí Version compatibility ‚Üí Feature availability ‚Üí Debug access |
| `#connection-manager-toggle` | Open connection manager | Opens modal interface | Visual feedback on click | ‚Üí Modal appearance ‚Üí Data refresh ‚Üí Connection details ‚Üí Management options |

### **MODAL INTERFACES**

## üìä **UNIVERSAL METRICS & MONITORING**

### **Performance Expectations:**
- **Button Response**: < 100ms visual feedback
- **IPC Calls**: < 500ms for standard operations
- **Modal Animations**: 200-300ms smooth transitions  
- **List Updates**: < 50ms for incremental updates
- **Search Results**: < 1000ms for complex queries

### **Error Boundaries:**
- **Network Errors**: Automatic retry with exponential backoff
- **IPC Failures**: Fallback to local state, user notification
- **UI Errors**: Component isolation, graceful degradation
- **Data Corruption**: Validation, backup restoration

### **User Experience Standards:**
- **Loading States**: Always visible for operations > 200ms
- **Error Messages**: Clear, actionable, non-technical
- **Success Feedback**: Immediate, contextually appropriate
- **Undo Capability**: Available for destructive operations
- **Data Persistence**: Automatic save, manual save options

# COMPREHENSIVE DOM EXPECTATIONS & FUNCTION MAPPING
## Chrome Container App - Universal Interface Documentation

**GREP INSTRUCTION FOR AGENTS:** `grep -r "getElementById\|querySelector" apps/chrome-container/chrome-container-app/ --include="*.js" --include="*.html" | grep -E "(element-id-from-table)" | head -5` - Use this to trace all files that interact with any DOM element from the tables below.

This document defines the **complete behavioral contract** for every interactive DOM element across all interfaces within the Chrome Container App ecosystem. Each DOM element has dedicated tables showing expectations, snowball actions, and file dependencies.

## üìÅ **INTERFACE HIERARCHY**
- `renderer/index.html` ‚Üí Main Chrome Container Interface
- `public/index.html` ‚Üí Curatated Social Discovery Interface  
- `public/canvas.html` ‚Üí TLDraw Canvas Editor Interface
- `public/auth.html` ‚Üí Authentication Interface
- `public/profile.html` ‚Üí User Profile Interface
- `public/strike-errors.html` ‚Üí Strike Errors Analysis Interface

## üîÑ **UNIVERSAL TRACE CONTRACT**
All interactions MUST produce: `invoke:start|success|error`, `ui:click`, `ui:gesture:start|move|end`, `ui:state-change`, `renderer:init|ready|error`

---

# üéØ MAIN CHROME CONTAINER INTERFACE (`renderer/index.html`)

## DOM Element: `#header-toggle-left`

| **Property** | **Value** |
|---|---|
| **Description** | Toggle left sidebar visibility |
| **Location** | `renderer/index.html:89` |
| **Function Chain** | `addEventListener('click')` ‚Üí `toggleToolbar('leftToolbar')` |
| **Files Involved** | `renderer/app.js:86`, `renderer/index.html:89` |

### **Expectations & State**
| **Trigger** | **Expected UI State** | **Performance** |
|---|---|---|
| Click | Sidebar slides in/out, arrow rotates ‚óÄ/‚ñ∂ | < 100ms response |
| During Animation | Main content width adjusts smoothly | 200-300ms transition |
| Completed | Layout classes updated, state persisted | localStorage saved |

### **Snowball Action Chain**
| **Step** | **Action** | **File:Line** | **Expected Outcome** |
|---|---|---|---|
| 1 | Update toolbar classes | `app.js:493` | `.collapsed` toggle |
| 2 | Rotate arrow icon | `app.js:496` | ‚óÄ ‚Üî ‚ñ∂ direction change |
| 3 | Trigger resize events | `app.js:500` | Layout recalculation |
| 4 | Save state to localStorage | `app.js:501` | Persistence across sessions |

## DOM Element: `#header-toggle-right`

## DOM Element: `#header-reset-layout`

| **Description** | Reset all panel sizes to default |
| **Location** | `renderer/index.html:91` |
| **Function Chain** | `addEventListener('click')` ‚Üí `resetLayoutSizing()` |

### **Expectations & State**

### **Snowball Action Chain**

## üîÑ **UNIVERSAL BEHAVIORAL PATTERNS**

### **State Management Chain:**
1. **User Interaction** ‚Üí UI feedback ‚Üí Loading state
2. **Function Execution** ‚Üí IPC communication ‚Üí Backend processing  
3. **Result Handling** ‚Üí UI updates ‚Üí State persistence
4. **Error Handling** ‚Üí User notification ‚Üí Recovery options
5. **Performance Tracking** ‚Üí Analytics ‚Üí Optimization triggers

### **Accessibility Chain:**
1. **Keyboard Navigation** ‚Üí Focus management ‚Üí Screen reader announcements
2. **Color Contrast** ‚Üí Theme compliance ‚Üí User preference respect
3. **Motion Preference** ‚Üí Animation controls ‚Üí Alternative displays

### **Performance Chain:**
1. **Interaction Start** ‚Üí Immediate feedback ‚Üí Progress indication
2. **Processing** ‚Üí Background optimization ‚Üí Resource management
3. **Completion** ‚Üí Smooth transitions ‚Üí Memory cleanup
4. **Monitoring** ‚Üí Performance metrics ‚Üí Optimization triggers

### **Error Recovery Chain:**
1. **Error Detection** ‚Üí User notification ‚Üí Context preservation
2. **Recovery Options** ‚Üí Automatic retry ‚Üí Manual intervention
3. **State Restoration** ‚Üí Data recovery ‚Üí UI synchronization
4. **Prevention** ‚Üí Validation ‚Üí Guard clauses

## üìä **UNIVERSAL METRICS & MONITORING**

### **Performance Expectations:**
- **Button Response**: < 100ms visual feedback
- **IPC Calls**: < 500ms for standard operations
- **Modal Animations**: 200-300ms smooth transitions  
- **List Updates**: < 50ms for incremental updates
- **Search Results**: < 1000ms for complex queries

### **Error Boundaries:**
- **Network Errors**: Automatic retry with exponential backoff
- **IPC Failures**: Fallback to local state, user notification
- **UI Errors**: Component isolation, graceful degradation
- **Data Corruption**: Validation, backup restoration

### **User Experience Standards:**
- **Loading States**: Always visible for operations > 200ms
- **Error Messages**: Clear, actionable, non-technical
- **Success Feedback**: Immediate, contextually appropriate
- **Undo Capability**: Available for destructive operations
- **Data Persistence**: Automatic save, manual save options

# COMPREHENSIVE DOM EXPECTATIONS & FUNCTION MAPPING
## Chrome Container App - Universal Interface Documentation

**GREP INSTRUCTION FOR AGENTS:** `grep -r "getElementById\|querySelector" apps/chrome-container/chrome-container-app/ --include="*.js" --include="*.html" | grep -E "(element-id-from-table)" | head -5` - Use this to trace all files that interact with any DOM element from the tables below.

This document defines the **complete behavioral contract** for every interactive DOM element across all interfaces within the Chrome Container App ecosystem. Each DOM element has dedicated tables showing expectations, snowball actions, and file dependencies.

## üìÅ **INTERFACE HIERARCHY**
- `renderer/index.html` ‚Üí Main Chrome Container Interface
- `public/index.html` ‚Üí Curatated Social Discovery Interface  
- `public/canvas.html` ‚Üí TLDraw Canvas Editor Interface
- `public/auth.html` ‚Üí Authentication Interface
- `public/profile.html` ‚Üí User Profile Interface
- `public/strike-errors.html` ‚Üí Strike Errors Analysis Interface

## üîÑ **UNIVERSAL TRACE CONTRACT**
All interactions MUST produce: `invoke:start|success|error`, `ui:click`, `ui:gesture:start|move|end`, `ui:state-change`, `renderer:init|ready|error`

---

# üéØ MAIN CHROME CONTAINER INTERFACE (`renderer/index.html`)

## DOM Element: `#header-toggle-left`

| **Property** | **Value** |
|---|---|
| **Description** | Toggle left sidebar visibility |
| **Location** | `renderer/index.html:89` |
| **Function Chain** | `addEventListener('click')` ‚Üí `toggleToolbar('leftToolbar')` |
| **Files Involved** | `renderer/app.js:86`, `renderer/index.html:89` |

### **Expectations & State**
| **Trigger** | **Expected UI State** | **Performance** |
|---|---|---|
| Click | Sidebar slides in/out, arrow rotates ‚óÄ/‚ñ∂ | < 100ms response |
| During Animation | Main content width adjusts smoothly | 200-300ms transition |
| Completed | Layout classes updated, state persisted | localStorage saved |

### **Snowball Action Chain**
| **Step** | **Action** | **File:Line** | **Expected Outcome** |
|---|---|---|---|
| 1 | Update toolbar classes | `app.js:493` | `.collapsed` toggle |
| 2 | Rotate arrow icon | `app.js:496` | ‚óÄ ‚Üî ‚ñ∂ direction change |
| 3 | Trigger resize events | `app.js:500` | Layout recalculation |
| 4 | Save state to localStorage | `app.js:501` | Persistence across sessions |

---

## DOM Element: `#header-toggle-right`

| **Property** | **Value** |
|---|---|
| **Description** | Toggle right sidebar visibility |
| **Location** | `renderer/index.html:90` |

| During Animation | Terminal content reflows smoothly | 200-300ms transition |
| Completed | Layout classes updated, state persisted | localStorage saved |

### **Snowball Action Chain**
| **Step** | **Action** | **File:Line** | **Expected Outcome** |
|---|---|---|---|
| 1 | Update toolbar classes | `app.js:493` | `.collapsed` toggle |
| 2 | Rotate arrow icon | `app.js:496` | ‚ñ∂ ‚Üî ‚óÄ direction change |
| 3 | Trigger resize events | `app.js:500` | Layout recalculation |
| 4 | Save state to localStorage | `app.js:501` | Persistence across sessions |

## DOM Element: `#header-reset-layout`

| **Property** | **Value** |
|---|---|
| **Description** | Reset all panel sizes to default |
| **Location** | `renderer/index.html:91` |
| **Function Chain** | `addEventListener('click')` ‚Üí `resetLayoutSizing()` |
| **Files Involved** | `renderer/app.js:91`, `renderer/index.html:91` |

### **Expectations & State**
| **Trigger** | **Expected UI State** | **Performance** |
|---|---|---|

| During Reset | Custom sizing cleared instantly | No animation delay |
| Completed | Clean default layout restored | CSS variables reset |

### **Snowball Action Chain**

| 2 | Collapse right toolbar | `app.js:509` | `.collapsed` class added |
| 3 | Clear inline styles | `app.js:508-509` | `style.width = ''` |
| 4 | Trigger layout recalc | Browser native | Default CSS applied |

## DOM Element: `#header-screenshot-btn`

| **Property** | **Value** |
|---|---|
| **Description** | Global screenshot capture |
| **Location** | `renderer/index.html` (header section) |
| **Function Chain** | `connectButton` ‚Üí `window.electronAPI.takeScreenshot` |
| **Files Involved** | `renderer/app.js:40`, `renderer/index.html` |

### **Expectations & State**

| Click | Button disables for 500ms | < 100ms response |
| During Capture | Loading state indicator | IPC < 500ms |
| Success | Notification + counter update | Gallery refresh |

### **Snowball Action Chain**
| **Step** | **Action** | **File:Line** | **Expected Outcome** |

3. **Completion** ‚Üí Smooth transitions ‚Üí Memory cleanup
4. **Monitoring** ‚Üí Performance metrics ‚Üí Optimization triggers

## üìä **UNIVERSAL METRICS & MONITORING**

### **Performance Expectations:**
- **Button Response**: < 100ms visual feedback
- **IPC Calls**: < 500ms for standard operations
- **Modal Animations**: 200-300ms smooth transitions  
- **List Updates**: < 50ms for incremental updates
- **Search Results**: < 1000ms for complex queries

### **Error Boundaries:**
- **Network Errors**: Automatic retry with exponential backoff
- **IPC Failures**: Fallback to local state, user notification
- **UI Errors**: Component isolation, graceful degradation
- **Data Corruption**: Validation, backup restoration

### **User Experience Standards:**
- **Loading States**: Always visible for operations > 200ms
- **Error Messages**: Clear, actionable, non-technical
- **Success Feedback**: Immediate, contextually appropriate
- **Undo Capability**: Available for destructive operations
- **Data Persistence**: Automatic save, manual save options

# COMPREHENSIVE DOM EXPECTATIONS & FUNCTION MAPPING
## Chrome Container App - Complete Directory-Mapped DOM Analysis

**GREP INSTRUCTION FOR AGENTS:** `grep -rn "getElementById\|querySelector\|data-.*=" chrome-container-app/ --include="*.js" --include="*.html" | grep -E "(element-id-from-table)" | head -10` - Use this to trace all files that interact with any DOM element from the tables below.

This document provides **1:1 directory-mapped DOM analysis** with mermaid trace diagrams for every interactive element in the Chrome Container App. Each DOM element includes complete workflow visualization through the chrome-container-app directory structure.

## üèóÔ∏è **CHROME-CONTAINER-APP DIRECTORY STRUCTURE**
```
chrome-container-app/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ main.js                     # Electron main process
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ preload.js                  # Context bridge setup
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ package.json                # Dependencies and scripts
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ renderer/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ index.html             # Main Chrome Container Interface
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ app.js                 # Primary renderer logic  
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ styles.css             # Main styling
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ public/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ index.html             # Curatated Social Discovery
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ canvas.html            # TLDraw Canvas Editor
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ auth.html              # Authentication Interface
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ profile.html           # User Profile Interface
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ strike-errors.html     # Strike Errors Analysis
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ css/                   # Stylesheets directory
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ js/                    # JavaScript modules
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ src/                       # Backend source code
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ chrome/                # Chrome automation
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ core/                  # Core application logic
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ ipc/                   # IPC handlers

# COMPREHENSIVE DOM EXPECTATIONS & FUNCTION MAPPING
## Chrome Container App - Complete Directory-Mapped DOM Analysis

**GREP INSTRUCTION FOR AGENTS:** `grep -rn "getElementById\|querySelector\|data-.*=" chrome-container-app/ --include="*.js" --include="*.html" | grep -E "(element-id-from-table)" | head -10` - Use this to trace all files that interact with any DOM element from the tables below.

This document provides **1:1 directory-mapped DOM analysis** with mermaid trace diagrams for every interactive element in the Chrome Container App. Each DOM element includes complete workflow visualization through the chrome-container-app directory structure.

## üèóÔ∏è **CHROME-CONTAINER-APP DIRECTORY STRUCTURE**
```
chrome-container-app/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ main.js                     # Electron main process
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ preload.js                  # Context bridge setup
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ package.json                # Dependencies and scripts
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ renderer/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ index.html             # Main Chrome Container Interface
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ app.js                 # Primary renderer logic  
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ styles.css             # Main styling
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ public/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ index.html             # Curatated Social Discovery
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ canvas.html            # TLDraw Canvas Editor
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ auth.html              # Authentication Interface
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ profile.html           # User Profile Interface
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ strike-errors.html     # Strike Errors Analysis
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ css/                   # Stylesheets directory
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ js/                    # JavaScript modules
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ src/                       # Backend source code
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ chrome/                # Chrome automation
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ core/                  # Core application logic
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ ipc/                   # IPC handlers
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ strike-errors/         # AI analysis system
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ terminal/              # Terminal management
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ screenshots/               # Screenshot storage
```

All DOM interactions MUST produce: `invoke:start|success|error`, `ui:click`, `ui:gesture:start|move|end`, `ui:state-change`, `renderer:init|ready|error`

This document provides **1:1 directory-mapped DOM analysis** with mermaid trace diagrams for every interactive element in the Chrome Container App. Each DOM element includes complete workflow visualization through the chrome-container-app directory structure.

# COMPREHENSIVE DOM EXPECTATIONS & FUNCTION MAPPING
## Chrome Container App - Complete Directory-Mapped DOM Analysis

**GREP INSTRUCTION FOR AGENTS:** `grep -rn "getElementById\|querySelector\|data-.*=" chrome-container-app/ --include="*.js" --include="*.html" | grep -E "(element-id-from-table)" | head -10` - Use this to trace all files that interact with any DOM element from the tables below.

This document provides **1:1 directory-mapped DOM analysis** with mermaid trace diagrams for every interactive element in the Chrome Container App. Each DOM element includes complete workflow visualization through the chrome-container-app directory structure.

## üèóÔ∏è **CHROME-CONTAINER-APP DIRECTORY STRUCTURE**
```
chrome-container-app/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ main.js                     # Electron main process
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ preload.js                  # Context bridge setup
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ package.json                # Dependencies and scripts
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ renderer/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ index.html             # Main Chrome Container Interface
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ app.js                 # Primary renderer logic  
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ styles.css             # Main styling
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ public/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ index.html             # Curatated Social Discovery
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ canvas.html            # TLDraw Canvas Editor
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ auth.html              # Authentication Interface
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ profile.html           # User Profile Interface
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ strike-errors.html     # Strike Errors Analysis
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ css/                   # Stylesheets directory
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ js/                    # JavaScript modules
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ src/                       # Backend source code
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ chrome/                # Chrome automation
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ core/                  # Core application logic
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ ipc/                   # IPC handlers
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ strike-errors/         # AI analysis system
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ terminal/              # Terminal management
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ screenshots/               # Screenshot storage
```

## üéØ **UNIVERSAL TRACE CONTRACT**
All DOM interactions MUST produce: `invoke:start|success|error`, `ui:click`, `ui:gesture:start|move|end`, `ui:state-change`, `renderer:init|ready|error`

## üé® **PRETTIER & LANGEXTRACT MANDATE - ABSOLUTELY REQUIRED**

### **MANDATORY CODE QUALITY ENFORCEMENT:**

#### **Prettier - EVERY CODE EDIT MUST:**
1. **BEFORE ANY CODE CHANGES**: Run `npx prettier --check` on target files
2. **AFTER EVERY EDIT**: Run `npx prettier --write` on modified files
3. **BEFORE DECLARING COMPLETE**: Run `npm run format:check` on entire codebase
4. **NO EXCEPTIONS**: Even single-line changes MUST be formatted

#### **Prettier Configuration (ENFORCED):**
```json
{
  "semi": true,
  "trailingComma": "es5",
  "singleQuote": true,
  "printWidth": 100,
  "tabWidth": 2,
  "useTabs": false,
  "bracketSpacing": true,
  "arrowParens": "avoid",
